_ : Message
id : 652
peer_id : {'_': 'PeerChannel', 'channel_id': 1204700902}
date : 2022-07-20 08:30:59+00:00
message : Neural Networks and the Chomsky Hierarchy
Gr√©goire Del√©tang, Anian Ruoss, Jordi Grau-Moya, Tim Genewein, Li Kevin Wenliang, Elliot Catt, Marcus Hutter, Shane Legg, Pedro A. Ortega
–°—Ç–∞—Ç—å—è: https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.02098 
–ö–æ–¥ (–Ω–∞ JAX): https://github.com/deepmind/neural_networks_chomsky_hierarchy 

–ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞ –æ—Ç –∑–≤—ë–∑–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞ –∏–∑ DeepMind –ø–æ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—É –æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ö –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ç–µ–π. –ê–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—ã –∑–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç —Å–æ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π –∏ –ø—ã—Ç–∞—é—Ç—Å—è —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–µ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ç–µ–≤—ã–µ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã (–∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏–∫–∞ –≤ –≤–∏–¥–µ RNN, LSTM, Transformer + memory-augmented —Å–µ—Ç–∏) –ø–æ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è–º –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏–∏ –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ. –î–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –æ–Ω–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–ª–∏ –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–µ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ 2200 –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–µ–π –ø–æ 16 –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∞–º. –¢–∞–∫–∞—è –≥—Ä—É–ø–ø–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–∞ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á –ø–æ –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏–∏ –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –¥–∞—ë—Ç –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–∞ –ª–∏ –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω–∞—è –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –∫ –æ–±–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—é –Ω–∞ out-of-distribution –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö.

–î–ª—è —Ç–µ—Ö, –∫—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞–ª, –Ω–æ –∑–∞–±—ã–ª: –ò–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏—è –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ.

–ü–æ –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–º—É, —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –∏ —è–∑—ã–∫–∏ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å –Ω–∞ 4 —Ç–∏–ø–∞ –ø–æ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ö–∞–∂–¥–æ–π –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–µ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç —è–∑—ã–∫, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –æ–Ω–∞ –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∏—Ç, —Ç–∏–ø —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞—é—â–µ–≥–æ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π —è–∑—ã–∫ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∞, –∏ –≤–∏–¥ –µ—ë –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª (–ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ü–∏–π).

–°–∞–º—ã–π –Ω–∏–∂–Ω–∏–π (–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π) —Ç–∏–ø 3 (Type-3) —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∏–∑ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö —è–∑—ã–∫–æ–≤, —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞–µ–º—ã—Ö –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω—ã–º –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–æ–º. –í—ã—à–µ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ–º –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç—Å—è –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–Ω–æ-—Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω—ã–µ —è–∑—ã–∫–∏, Type-2, —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–æ–º —Å–æ —Å—Ç–µ–∫–æ–º –∏–ª–∏ –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ø–∞–º—è—Ç—å—é (pushdown automaton). –ï—â—ë –≤—ã—à–µ –ª–µ–∂–∞—Ç Type-1, –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–Ω–æ-–∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º—ã–µ —è–∑—ã–∫–∏, —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–µ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–æ–π –º–∞—à–∏–Ω—ã –¢—å—é—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–∞ –ø–æ–¥ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –ª–∏–Ω–µ–π–Ω–æ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç (linear bounded automaton), —É –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–∑–º–µ—Ä –ª–µ–Ω—Ç—ã ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ç–∞ –æ—Ç –¥–ª–∏–Ω—ã –≤—Ö–æ–¥–∞. –ù—É –∏ –Ω–∞–∫–æ–Ω–µ—Ü Type-0, –Ω–µ–æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ (–æ–Ω–∏ –∂–µ —Ä–µ–∫—É—Ä—Å–∏–≤–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–∏—Å–ª–∏–º—ã–µ) —è–∑—ã–∫–∏, —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞–µ–º—ã–µ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–æ–π –¢—å—é—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–∞.

–í –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∫ –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏–∏ –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—ã —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–∞—Ç—Ä–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω—ã–µ —è–∑—ã–∫–∏ (—Å –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω—ã–º –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä–æ–º —Å–ª–æ–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å –ø–æ look-up table), —Ä–∞–∑–¥–µ–ª—è—é—Ç –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–Ω–æ-—Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω—ã–µ —è–∑—ã–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ –¥–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–º–∏–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∏ –Ω–µ–¥–µ—Ç–µ—Ä–º–∏–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ, –∏ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç —Å—á—ë—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —è–∑—ã–∫–∏ (counter languages), –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–µ–µ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö, –Ω–æ –≤—Ö–æ–¥—è—Ç –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–Ω–æ-–∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º—ã–µ.

–ö–æ–º—É –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ –ø–æ–≥–ª—É–±–∂–µ –≤–ª–µ–∑—Ç—å –≤ —Ç–µ–º—É, –µ—Å—Ç—å –ø–∞—Ä–∞ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏—Ö –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –í–æ–ª–æ–¥–∏ –õ–∞–ø—à–∏–Ω–∞ –ø–æ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º —è–∑—ã–∫–∞–º (https://habr.com/en/post/177109/) –∏ –ø–æ—Ä–æ–∂–¥–∞—é—â–∏–º –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∞–º (https://habr.com/en/post/177701/). –ê –≤ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ –ª–∏—Ä–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –æ—Ç—Å—Ç—É–ø–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è –≤–æ—Å–∫—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —á—Ç–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é –º–æ–π —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—ã–π –ø–æ—Å—Ç, –æ –±–æ–∂–µ, 14-–ª–µ—Ç–Ω–µ–π –¥–∞–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, –ø—Ä–æ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é –ø–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ–ø–∞–¥–∞—é—â–µ–π –≤ Type-2 –ø–æ –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–º—É BNF –∏ —Å–≤—è–∑—å –µ—ë —Å —Å–∞–Ω—Å–∫—Ä–∏—Ç–æ–º (https://che-shr-cat.livejournal.com/7084.html). 

–ò—Ç–∞–∫, –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏—è –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –¥–ª—è –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫ –ø–æ —Å—Ç–µ–ø–µ–Ω–∏ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –ö–∞–∂–¥–æ–º—É —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—é –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏–∏ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É–µ—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω—ã–π —Ä–µ—à–∞—Ç—å –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∞. –ù–∞ –Ω–∏–∂–Ω–µ–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏–∏ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç —Ä–µ—à–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω—ã–π –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç —Å –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ø–∞–º—è—Ç—å—é, –Ω–∞ –≤–µ—Ä—Ö–Ω–µ–º ‚Äî –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∞ –¢—å—é—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–∞ —Å –Ω–µ–æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ø–∞–º—è—Ç—å—é (–±–µ—Å–∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ–π –ª–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–π). –ù–æ –≤ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏–µ –æ—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–æ–≤, –±—ã–ª–æ –Ω–µ—è—Å–Ω–æ, –≥–¥–µ –≤ –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏–∏ –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–ª–∞–≥–∞—é—Ç—Å—è —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ç–µ–≤—ã–µ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã. –ê —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–º –¥–µ–ª–µ –Ω–µ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å.

–¢–∞–∫, —Ö–æ—Ç—è –ø—Ä–æ RNN –≤—Ä–æ–¥–µ –∫–∞–∫ –∏–∑–≤–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ –æ–Ω–∏ –≤ —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–∏–∏ Turing-complete (—Ö–æ—Ç—è –±—ã–ª–∏ –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã, –æ—Ç–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è—é—â–∏–µ RNN –≤ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ-–Ω–∏–∑–∫–∏–µ –ø–ª–∞–Ω—ã –±—ã—Ç–∏—è), –≥—Ä–∞–¥–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥—ã –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫ –ø–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤—É –ø–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤, –≤–Ω–æ—Å—è —Å–≤–æ–∏ inductive biases, —Ç–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç —É–∂–µ –Ω–µ –±—ã—Ç—å —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∏ –Ω–µ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –ª—É—á—à–µ–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –°–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —Ü–µ–ª—å –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã ‚Äî –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–µ –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å –≥–¥–µ –≤ –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏–∏ –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ª–µ–∂–∞—Ç —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–µ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã —Å –∏—Ö —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–º–∏ —Å–æ–ø—É—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–º–∏ (–æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ—Ç –≥—Ä–∞–¥–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–æ–≤) inductive biases.

–ë—ã–ª–∏ –∏ –¥–æ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã, –ø—ã—Ç–∞–≤—à–∏–µ—Å—è –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å, –∫–∞–∫ —Å–µ—Ç–∏ –≤—ã—É—á–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç —è–∑—ã–∫–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–∏–ø–æ–≤. –ë—ã–ª–æ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–∞—è –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è –≤—ã—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ–Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –∏–µ—Ä–∞—Ä—Ö–∏–∏ –•–æ–º—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ. –¢–∞–∫, –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ—Ä—ã –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–µ–≥—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã–µ —è–∑—ã–∫–∏, –∑–∞—Ç–æ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –≤—ã—É—á–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ. –ù–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ –æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å –≤—Å—ë —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–µ —Å —É—á—ë—Ç–æ–º –≥—Ä–∞–¥–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–æ–≤ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è.

message : –ù–∞—á–∞–ª—Å—è –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –≤ —Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∞ü§ñ

–§–æ–Ω–¥ –°–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –∏–Ω–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ü–∏—è–º –æ–±—ä—è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç –æ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–µ –æ—Ç–±–æ—Ä–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –ø–æ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å—É ¬´–°—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç-–ò—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç-1¬ª –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º—ã ¬´–°—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç¬ª - –∑–∞—è–≤–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –¥–æ 29 –∞–≤–≥—É—Å—Ç–∞ 2022 –≥–æ–¥–∞.
 
–ü—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç—å —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç—ã –ø–æ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è–º: 
 üîπ–∫–æ–º–ø—å—é—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–µ –∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ; 
üîπ–æ–±—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞; 
üîπ—Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏ —Å–∏–Ω—Ç–µ–∑ —Ä–µ—á–∏; 
üîπ–∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π; 
üîπ–ø–µ—Ä—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥—ã –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∞. 

–°—É–º–º–∞ –≥—Ä–∞–Ω—Ç–∞ ‚Äî –¥–æ 4 –º–ª–Ω —Ä—É–±–ª–µ–π, —Å—Ä–æ–∫ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –ù–ò–û–ö–† ‚Äî 12 –º–µ—Å—è—Ü–µ–≤. 
 
‚òùüèª–í —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å–∞ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–Ω—ã —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è, –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—é—â–∏–µ –∏–º–∏—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–≥–Ω–∏—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞ (–≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—è —Å–∞–º–æ–æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –±–µ–∑ –∑–∞—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∞–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º–∞) –∏ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∏ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã, —Å–æ–ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–º—ã–µ, –∫–∞–∫ –º–∏–Ω–∏–º—É–º, —Å —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∞–º–∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞. 
 
–í –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –∫–∞–∫ —Ñ–∏–∑–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ª–∏—Ü–∞, —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ —é—Ä–∏–¥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ª–∏—Ü–∞-—Å—É–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç—ã –º–∞–ª–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –∑–∞—Ä–µ–≥–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 2-—Ö –ª–µ—Ç –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥. 

üìå–ü–æ–¥—Ä–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–π—Ç–µ

–ü–æ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∞–º, —Å–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º —Å –ø–æ–¥–∞—á–µ–π –∑–∞—è–≤–æ–∫, –æ–±—Ä–∞—â–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—å –≤ —Ä–µ–≥–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–æ –§–æ–Ω–¥–∞ —Å–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –∏–Ω–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ü–∏—è–º - –ù–æ–≤–æ—Å–∏–±–∏—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–æ–π –∏–Ω–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ñ–æ–Ω–¥ –ø–æ e-mail: ayriyants@academpark.com, –ê–Ω–Ω–∞ –ê–π—Ä–∏—è–Ω—Ü, —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç –†–ü –§–°–ò –ø–æ –ù–°–û.

–ù–∞ –≤–µ–±–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–µ, –ø–æ—Å–≤—è—â–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å—É ¬´–ê–Ω—Ç–∏–∫—Ä–∏–∑–∏—Å-–ò–ò¬ª, –º—ã –æ–±—Å—É–¥–∏–º:

‚Ä¢ –ö–∞–∫–∏–º –∫—Ä–∏—Ç–µ—Ä–∏—è–º –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–∞ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏—è –≤ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å–µ ¬´–ê–Ω—Ç–∏–∫—Ä–∏–∑–∏—Å-–ò–ò¬ª;
‚Ä¢ –ö–∞–∫—É—é –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—é –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç—å —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ –≤ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å–µ;
‚Ä¢ –ü–æ—Ä—è–¥–æ–∫ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞—è–≤–æ–∫;

message : –†–∞–∑–±–æ—Ä —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–∏ –æ—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ - DORA: Exploring outlier representations in Deep Neural Networks

–ù–µ–¥–∞–≤–Ω–æ –≤ arxiv –±—ã–ª–∞ –æ–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—è –ø–æ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–µ –æ–±–Ω–∞—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –∞–Ω–æ–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π –≤ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç—è—Ö. –ö–∏—Ä–∏–ª–ª –ë—ã–∫–æ–≤, PhD student –≤ TU Berlin ‚Äì Understandable Machine Intelligence Lab, —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫ –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ –Ω–µ–¥–∞–≤–Ω–µ–≥–æ –∫—Ä—É–≥–ª–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–∞ –ø–æ Interpretable ML, —Å–æ–∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–∏, —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –æ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥–∞—Ö –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è:

"–ü–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π –æ–±—É—Å–ª–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∞ –∏—Ö —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –∫ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—é —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –≤—ã—Å–æ–∫–æ—É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ–≤—ã—Ö –∞–±—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∫—Ü–∏–π. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–µ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å–µ—Ç–∏ —Å–∫–ª–æ–Ω–Ω—ã –∫ –≤—ã—É—á–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –∞—Ä—Ç–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∏ –≤—Ä–µ–¥–æ–Ω–æ—Å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ç–µ—Ä–µ–æ—Ç–∏–ø–æ–≤ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –ø–∞–≥—É–±–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–ª—è—Ü–∏–π, –ø—Ä–∏—Å—É—â–∏—Ö –æ–±—É—á–∞—é—â–µ–π –≤—ã–±–æ—Ä–∫–µ, —á—Ç–æ –≤ –¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ–π—à–µ–º –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –∫ –æ—à–∏–±–∫–∞–º –≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ –∞–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º–∞. –í —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥ –¥–ª—è –¥–∏–∞–≥–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π –¥–ª—è –æ–±–Ω–∞—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ "–∑–∞—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö" —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π –≤ –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç—è—Ö ‚Äì DORA (Data-agnOstic Representation Analysis). –ó–∞—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –Ω–∞–π–¥–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é DORA, –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã –¥–ª—è –≤—ã—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö ‚Äî –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä —Å –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–º —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∏–∑ –æ–±—É—á–∞—é—â–µ–π –≤—ã–±–æ—Ä–∫–∏ –∏ —Ä–µ-—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∫–æ–π —Å–µ—Ç–∏.

–ú–µ—Ç–æ–¥ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω –Ω–∞ –∏–¥–µ–µ "—Å–∞–º–æ–æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è" –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π –ø—É—Ç–µ–º –∏–∑–≤–ª–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–µ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏, —Å–æ–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞—â–µ–π—Å—è –≤ —Å–∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Å–∏–≥–Ω–∞–ª–∞—Ö, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏(s-AMS), –∏ –¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ–π—à–µ–≥–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è —ç—Ç–æ–π –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –¥–ª—è –≤—ã—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∞–Ω–æ–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö (–∏ –ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –∑–∞—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö) —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π. 

–í —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–µ –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π-–¥–µ—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤-–≤–æ–¥—è–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–≤ –≤ –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç—è—Ö –Ω–∞ ImageNet, –∏ –≤–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç—Å—è, –≤ –∫–∞–∫–∏—Ö –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω–æ —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏—è—Ö —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç –∏–∑–æ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω. –î–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –¥–∞–∂–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ finetuning'–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ —Ç–∞–∫–∏—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π –≤ critical-safety –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç—è—Ö, —Ç–∞–∫–∏—Ö –∫–∞–∫ –º–µ–¥–∏—Ü–∏–Ω–∞.

–í –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ –º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–∏ "–∏–Ω—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏" —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π –≤—Ä–µ–¥–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∞–±—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∫—Ü–∏—è–º–∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–∞ AUC ROC –¥–ª—è –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏ –±–∏–Ω–∞—Ä–Ω–æ–π –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—Ñ–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –º–µ–∂–¥—É –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ —Å –∏ –±–µ–∑ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –Ω–∞ –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –∞—Ä—Ç–µ—Ñ–∞–∫—Ç–æ–º ‚Äî –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –ª–∞—Ç–∏–Ω—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ –∏–ª–∏ –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ –≤–æ–¥—è–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∑–Ω–∞–∫–∞–º–∏. –¢–∞–∫, –≤ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–µ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ DORA —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–æ —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å –¥–µ—Ç–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–Ω—ã—Ö "–∏–Ω—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö" —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π.

DORA –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π —à–∞–≥ –∫ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–º—É –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑—É —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–π –≤ –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∏—Ö –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç—è—Ö ‚Äî –≤ —ç–ø–æ—Ö—É large-scale –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–µ–π, –ª–æ–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–æ–≤ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è (–æ—Ç–≤–µ—á–∞—é—â–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å –æ —Ç–æ–º, –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É –±—ã–ª–æ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç–æ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω–æ–º –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–µ) –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç–∏—è —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π. –¢–∞–∫, –≤ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å–µ DORA –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –∫ CLIP ‚Äî –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –æ—Ç OpenAI –¥–ª—è –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π. –£–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å  –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –≤—ã—è–≤–∏—Ç—å —Ä–µ–ø—Ä–µ–∑–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –æ—Ç–≤–µ—á–∞—é—â–∏–µ –∑–∞ —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ—Ä–Ω–æ–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–Ω—Ç–∞, –Ω–∞—Ä–∫–æ—Ç–∏–∫–æ–≤, –∞–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –∏ –¥—Ä."

–°—Å—ã–ª–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—é: https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.04530

networks to predict what was going to happen next in video clips of everyday events. In a draft document shared with MIT Technology Review, LeCun sketches out an approach that he thinks will one day give machines the common sense they need to navigate the world. (Update: LeCun has since posted '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'the document'}, 'url': 'https://openreview.net/forum?id=BZ5a1r-kVsf', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' online.)'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'For LeCun, the proposals could be the first steps on a path to building machines with the ability to reason and plan like humans‚Äîwhat many call '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'artificial general intelligence'}, 'url': 'https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/10/15/1010461/artificial-general-intelligence-robots-ai-agi-deepmind-google-openai/', 'webpage_id': 6712606878209283553}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', or AGI. He also steps away from today‚Äôs hottest trends in machine learning, resurrecting some old ideas that have gone out of fashion.\xa0'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'But his vision is far from comprehensive; indeed, it may raise more questions than it answers. The biggest question mark, as LeCun points out himself, is that he does not know how to build what he describes.\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockRelatedArticles', 'title': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}, 'articles': [{'_': 'PageRelatedArticle', 'url': 'https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/10/15/1010461/artificial-general-intelligence-robots-ai-agi-deepmind-google-openai/', 'webpage_id': 6712606878209283553, 'title': 'Artificial general intelligence: Are we close, and does it even make sense to try?', 'description': 'The idea of artificial general intelligence as we know it today starts with a dot-com blowout on Broadway.\xa0 Twenty years ago‚Äîbefore Shane Legg clicked with neuroscience postgrad Demis Hassabis over a shared fascination with intelligence; before the pair hooked up with Hassabis‚Äôs childhood friend Mustafa Suleyman, a progressive activist, to spin that fascination into a‚Ä¶', 'photo_id': 5783749080332217228, 'author': 'Will Douglas Heaven', 'published_date': datetime.datetime(2020, 10, 15, 10, 23, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The centerpiece of the new approach is a neural network that can learn to view the world at different levels of detail. Ditching the need for pixel-perfect predictions, this network would focus only on those features in a scene that are relevant for the task at hand. LeCun proposes pairing this core network with another, called the configurator, which determines what level of detail is required and tweaks the overall system accordingly.\xa0\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'For LeCun, AGI is going to be a part of how we interact with future tech. His vision is colored by that of his employer, Meta, which is pushing a virtual-reality metaverse. He says that in 10 or 15 years people won‚Äôt be carrying smartphones in their pockets, but augmented-reality glasses fitted with virtual assistants that will guide humans through their day. ‚ÄúFor those to be most useful to us, they basically have to have more or less human-level intelligence,‚Äù he says.\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúYann has been talking about many of these ideas for some time,‚Äù says Yoshua Bengio, an AI researcher at the University of Montreal and scientific director at the Mila-Quebec Institute. ‚ÄúBut it is good to see it all together, in one big picture.‚Äù Bengio thinks that LeCun asks the right questions. He also thinks it‚Äôs great that LeCun is willing to put out a document that has so few answers. It‚Äôs a research proposal rather than a set of clean results, he says.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúPeople talk about these things in private, but they‚Äôre not usually shared publicly,‚Äù says Bengio. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs risky.‚Äù'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'A matter of common sense'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'LeCun has been thinking about AI for nearly 40 years. In 2018 he was joint winner of computing‚Äôs top prize, the Turing Award, with Bengio and Geoffrey Hinton, for his pioneering work on deep learning. ‚ÄúGetting machines to behave like humans and animals has been the quest of my life,‚Äù he says.\xa0\xa0\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'LeCun thinks that animal brains run a kind of simulation of the world, which he calls a world model. Learned in infancy, it‚Äôs the way animals (including humans) make good guesses about what‚Äôs going on around them. Infants pick up the basics in the first few months of life by observing the world, says LeCun. Seeing a dropped ball fall a handful of times is enough to give a child a sense of how gravity works.\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúCommon sense‚Äù is the catch-all term for this kind of intuitive reasoning. It includes a grasp of simple physics: for example, knowing that the world is three-dimensional and that objects don‚Äôt actually disappear when they go out of view. It lets us predict where a bouncing ball or a speeding bike will be in a few seconds‚Äô time. And it helps us join the dots between incomplete pieces of information: if we hear a metallic crash from the kitchen, we can make an educated guess that someone has dropped a pan, because we know what kinds of objects make that noise and when they make it.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In short, common sense tells us what events are possible and impossible, and which events are more likely than others. It lets us foresee the consequences of our actions and make plans‚Äîand ignore irrelevant details.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'But teaching common sense to machines is hard. Today‚Äôs neural networks need to be shown thousands of examples before they start to spot such patterns.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In many ways common sense amounts to the ability to predict what‚Äôs going to happen next. ‚ÄúThis is the essence of intelligence,‚Äù says LeCun. That‚Äôs why he‚Äîand a few other researchers‚Äîhave been using\xa0 video clips to train their models.\xa0But existing machine-learning techniques required the models to predict exactly what is going to happen in the next frame and generate it pixel by pixel. Imagine you hold up a pen and let it go, LeCun says. Common sense tells you that the pen will fall, but not the exact position it will end up in. Predicting that would require crunching some tough physics equations.\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'That‚Äôs why LeCun is now trying to train a neural network that can focus only on the relevant aspects of the world: predicting that the pen will fall but not exactly how. He sees this trained network as the equivalent of the world model that animals rely on.\xa0\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Mystery ingredients'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'LeCun says he has built an early version of this world model that can do basic object recognition. He is now working on training it to make predictions. But how the configurator should work remains a mystery, he says. LeCun imagines that neural network as the controller for the whole system. It would decide what kind of predictions the world model should be making at any given time and what level of detail it should focus on to make those predictions possible, adjusting the world model as required.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'LeCun is convinced that something like a configurator is needed, but he doesn‚Äôt know how to go about training a neural network to do the job. ‚ÄúWe need to figure out a good recipe to make this work, and we don‚Äôt have that recipe yet,‚Äù he says.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In LeCun‚Äôs vision, the world model and the configurator are two key pieces in a larger system, known as a cognitive architecture, that includes other neural networks‚Äîsuch as a perception model that senses the world and a model that uses rewards to motivate the AI to explore or curb its behavior.\xa0\xa0\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Each neural network is roughly analogous to parts of the brain, says LeCun. For example, the configurator and world model are meant to replicate functions of the prefrontal cortex. The motivation model corresponds to certain functions of the amygdala, and so on.\xa0\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The idea of cognitive architectures, especially ones inspired by the brain, has been around for decades. So have many of LeCun‚Äôs ideas about prediction using models with different levels of detail. But when deep learning became the dominant approach in AI, many of these older ideas went out of fashion. ‚ÄúPeople in AI research have kind of forgotten about this a little bit,‚Äù he says.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'What he has done is taken these older ideas and rehabilitated them, suggesting ways that they can be combined with deep learning. For LeCun, revisiting these out-of-fashion ideas is essential, because he believes the two dominant approaches in modern AI are dead ends.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': "When it comes to building general-purpose AI, there are two main camps. In one, many researchers think the remarkable success of very large language or image-making models like OpenAI's "}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'GPT-3'}, 'url': 'https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/07/20/1005454/openai-machine-learning-language-generator-gpt-3-nlp/', 'webpage_id': 6712606878100129187}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' and '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'DALL-E'}, 'url': 'https://www.technologyreview.com/2022/04/06/1049061/dalle-openai-gpt3-ai-agi-multimodal-image-generation/', 'webpage_id': 6712606879732902992}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' show that all we need to do is just build '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'bigger and bigger models'}, 'url': 'https://www.technologyreview.com/2021/12/21/1042835/2021-was-the-year-of-monster-ai-models/', 'webpage_id': 6712606878725553393}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In the other camp are champions of reinforcement learning, the AI technique that rewards specific behaviors to make neural networks to learn by trial and error. This is the approach DeepMind used to train its game-playing AIs like AlphaZero. Get the rewards right, the argument goes, and reinforcement learning will eventually produce more general intelligence.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockRelatedArticles', 'title': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}, 'articles': [{'_': 'PageRelatedArticle', 'url': 'https://www.technologyreview.com/2021/02/24/1017797/gpt3-best-worst-ai-openai-natural-language/', 'webpage_id': 6712606878872105635, 'title': 'Why GPT-3 is the best and worst of AI right now', 'description': 'OpenAI‚Äôs language AI wowed the public with its apparent mastery of English‚Äîbut is it all an illusion?', 'photo_id': 5890125322786024422, 'author': 'Will Douglas Heaven', 'published_date': datetime.datetime(2021, 2, 24, 11, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': "LeCun is having none of it: ‚ÄúThis idea that we're going to just scale up the current large language models and eventually human-level AI will emerge‚ÄîI don‚Äôt believe this at all, not for one second.‚Äù These large models just manipulate words and images, he says. They have no direct experience of the world."}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'He is equally skeptical about reinforcement learning, because it requires vast amounts of data to train models to do even simple tasks. ‚ÄúI think that has no chance of working at all,‚Äù says LeCun.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'David Silver at DeepMind, who led the work on AlphaZero and is a big advocate of reinforcement learning, disagrees with this assessment but welcomes LeCun‚Äôs overall vision. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an exciting new proposal for how a world model could be represented and learned,‚Äù he says.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Melanie Mitchell, an AI researcher at the Santa Fe Institute, is also excited to see a whole new approach. ‚ÄúWe really haven‚Äôt seen this coming out of the deep-learning community so much,‚Äù she says. She also agrees with LeCun that large language models cannot be the whole story. ‚ÄúThey lack memory and internal models of the world that are actually really important,‚Äù she says.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Natasha Jaques, a researcher at Google Brain, thinks that language models should still play a role, however. It‚Äôs odd for language to be entirely missing from LeCun‚Äôs proposals, she says: ‚ÄúWe know that large language models are super effective and bake in a bunch of human knowledge.‚Äù'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Jaques, who works on ways to get AIs to share information and abilities with each other, points out that humans don‚Äôt have to have direct experience of something to learn about it. We can change our behavior simply by being told something, such as not to touch a hot pan. ‚ÄúHow do I update this world model that Yann is proposing if I don‚Äôt have language?‚Äù she asks.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'There‚Äôs another issue, too. If they were to work, LeCun‚Äôs ideas would create a powerful technology that could be as transformative as the internet.\xa0And yet\xa0his proposal doesn‚Äôt discuss how his model‚Äôs behavior and motivations would be controlled, or who would control them. This is a weird omission, says Abhishek Gupta, the founder of the Montreal AI Ethics Institute and a responsible-AI expert at Boston Consulting Group.\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúWe should think more about what it takes for AI to function well in a society, and that requires thinking about ethical behavior, amongst other things,‚Äù says Gupta.\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Yet Jaques notes that LeCun‚Äôs proposals are still very much ideas rather than practical applications. Mitchell says the same: ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs certainly little risk of this becoming a human-level intelligence anytime soon.‚Äù'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'LeCun would agree. His aim is to sow the seeds of a new approach in the hope that others build on it. ‚ÄúThis is something that is going to take a lot of effort from a lot of people,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm putting this out there because I think ultimately this is the way to go.‚Äù If nothing else, he wants to convince people that large language models and reinforcement learning are not the only ways forward.\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúI hate to see people wasting their time,‚Äù he says.'}}], 'photos': [{'_': 'Photo', 'id': 5783749080332217228, 'access_hash': –í—á–µ—Ä–∞ Meta* –≤—ã–ª–æ–∂–∏–ª–∏ —Å–≤–æ—é –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –Ω–∞ 66 –º–ª—Ä–¥. –ø–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤, –∏ –æ–±—ä—è–≤–∏–ª–∞ –µ—ë –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω–µ–π—à–µ–π, –Ω–æ –º–µ–Ω—å—à–µ —á–µ–º –∑–∞ —Å—É—Ç–∫–∏ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç —Ä–µ–∫–æ—Ä–¥ –±—ã–ª –ø–æ–±–∏—Ç –Ø–Ω–¥–µ–∫—Å–æ–º. –†–µ—á—å –æ —è–∑—ã–∫–æ–≤–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ YaLM 100B –Ω–∞ 100 –º–ª—Ä–¥ –ø–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤. –ú–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ YaLM –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—è—é—Ç—Å—è, –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –≤ –ê–ª–∏—Å–µ. 

YaLM 100B –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ 2 –¢–ë —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∏ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–æ–≤. –ü—Ä–∏—á—ë–º –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞ –í–∏–∫–∏–ø–µ–¥–∏–∏/–Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—è—Ö/–∫–Ω–∏–≥–∞—Ö, –Ω–æ –∏ –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–¥–µ –∏ –Ω–∞—É—á–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—è—Ö.

message : ARTIFICIAL¬†INTELLIGENCE DAY 2022

–û–±–∑–æ—Ä —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–π –ò–ò –∏ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è: –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —Ä–µ—à–∞–µ–º—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏, –ø–µ—Ä—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤—ã —Ä—ã–Ω–æ—á–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–π.
–ò–ò: —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ –¥–ª—è –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–∞ –∏ –¥–ª—è —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á. –°—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–µ–≥–∏—è —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—è –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∞ –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –†–µ–≥—É–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º–æ–≤. –ö–æ–¥–µ–∫—Å —ç—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –ò–ò.
–û–ø—ã—Ç –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è ¬´–∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∞¬ª –≤ —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–∞—Ö –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏: –ò–ò –≤ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤–æ–π –æ—Ç—Ä–∞—Å–ª–∏, –ò–ò –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ–º—ã—à–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏, —Ç–æ—Ä–≥–æ–≤–ª–∏, –∑–¥—Ä–∞–≤–æ–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Ç.–¥.
–ò–ò –∫–∞–∫ –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω–∞ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞: –≥–∏–±–∫–∏–µ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –±–µ–∑–ª—é–¥–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –±–µ—Å–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å–ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —Å—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–∞.
–ò–ò –∫–∞–∫ —É–º–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–º–æ—â–Ω–∏–∫ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞ ‚Äì –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª–∞: –≤—Ä–∞—á–∞, —é—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–∞ –∏ —Ç.–¥. –≠–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –∏ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—ã.
–¶–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤—ã–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –¥–ª—è —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–π: –æ—Ç —Å–∫–æ—Ä–∏–Ω–≥–æ–≤–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –∑–∞–µ–º—â–∏–∫–∞ –¥–æ —Ñ–∏–∑–∏–∫–æ-–º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ –≤—ã–ø–ª–∞–≤–∫–∏ —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∏. –¢–∏–ø—ã —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤—ã—Ö –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–µ–π –∏ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏—Ö –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è.

message : –ò—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–æ–≤. –î—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–∏–µ –∏ —Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≤–µ–∫–æ–≤—ã–µ –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–∏–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç—ã ‚Äå

–°–û–ì–õ–ê–°–ù–û –†–ê–°–ü–û–†–Ø–ñ–ï–ù–ò–Æ –ú–ò–ù–Æ–°–¢–ê –£–ö–ê–ó–´–í–ê–ï–ú, –ß–¢–û –î–ê–ù–ù–´–ô –ú–ê–¢–ï–†–ò–ê–õ (–ò–ù–§–û–†–ú–ê–¶–ò–Ø) –ü–†–û–ò–ó–í–ï–î–ï–ù, –†–ê–°–ü–†–û–°–¢–†–ê–ù–ï–ù –ò (–ò–õ–ò) –ù–ê–ü–†–ê–í–õ–ï–ù –ù–ï–ö–û–ú–ú–ï–†–ß–ï–°–ö–û–ô –û–†–ì–ê–ù–ò–ó–ê–¶–ò–ï–ô, –í–´–ü–û–õ–ù–Ø–Æ–©–ï–ô –§–£–ù–ö–¶–ò–ò –ò–ù–û–°–¢–†–ê–ù–ù–û–ì–û –ê–ì–ï–ù–¢–ê, –õ–ò–ë–û –ö–ê–°–ê–ï–¢–°–Ø –î–ï–Ø–¢–ï–õ–¨–ù–û–°–¢–ò –¢–ê–ö–û–ô –û–†–ì–ê–ù–ò–ó–ê–¶–ò–ò (–ü–û –°–ú–´–°–õ–£ –ü. 6 –°–¢. 2 –ò –ü. 1 –°–¢. 24 –§–ï–î–ï–†–ê–õ–¨–ù–û–ì–û –ó–ê–ö–û–ù–ê –û–¢ 12.01.1996 ‚Ññ 7-–§–ó)

–°–æ —à–∫–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π —Å–∫–∞–º—å–∏ –º—ã –∑–Ω–∞–µ–º –æ –≤–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–π –¥—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–µ–π –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–æ–π —Ü–∏–≤–∏–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –¢–∞–º, –Ω–∞ –í–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∫–µ, –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–µ–ª–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞—Å, –±—É–º–∞–≥—É, –ø–æ—Ä–æ—Ö –∏ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–µ –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–µ. –ê –∫–∞–∫ –≤ –ö–∏—Ç–∞–µ –æ–±—Å—Ç–æ—è–ª–∏ –¥–µ–ª–∞ —Å —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∞–º–∏ –∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∞–º–∏? –ù–µ—É–∂–µ–ª–∏ –∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –ü–æ–¥–Ω–µ–±–µ—Å–Ω–æ–π –æ—Ç—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞–ª–∏ –æ—Ç –≥—Ä–µ–∫–æ–≤ –∏ —Ä–∏–º–ª—è–Ω, –∏–Ω–¥—É—Å–æ–≤ –∏ –∞—Ä–∞–±–æ–≤ –≤ —ç—Ç–æ–π –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏?

"–ù–∞—É—á–Ω–æ-–ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω—ã–π" —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –Ω–∞ –ó–µ–º–ª–µ –ø—É—Ç—ë–º —Å–∞–º–æ–∑–∞—Ä–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ - –Ω–µ–≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ. –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ø–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å –∏ –≤—ã—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ—ë –º–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ (–≤ –∫–æ–º–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–∏—è—Ö...), –∞ —è –≤—ã—Å–∫–∞–∂—É —Å–≤–æ—ë –∑–¥–µ—Å—å.

 –ï—â—ë –≤ –¥—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–∏–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∞ –±—ã–ª–∞ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞—É–∫–∞ —Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∫–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è–µ—Ç –Ω–∞ –æ–¥–Ω–∏—Ö –∏ —Ç–µ—Ö –∂–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–æ–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ —É—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è (—á—Ç–æ –≤ –Ω–∞—à–∏ –¥–Ω–∏ —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–æ –≤ –º–∞—Å—Å-–º–µ–¥–∏–∞). –¢–∞–∫ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä "–ú–∏—Ñ–æ–≤ —ç–≤–æ–ª—é—Ü–∏–∏" –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–≥–æ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —É–∫—Ä–µ–ø–∏—Ç –≤ –µ–≥–æ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –≤–µ—Ä–µ. –¢–µ, –∫—Ç–æ –≤–µ—Ä—è—Ç –≤ –ë–æ–≥–∞ - —É–≤–∏–¥—è—Ç –¥–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–æ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á—Ç–æ –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∞ –∏–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —Ç–µ–º –ë–æ–≥–æ–º, –≤ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –æ–Ω–∏ –≤–µ—Ä—è—Ç (–≤ —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º–µ. –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –±–æ–≥–∏ –±–ª–∞–≥–æ—Ä–∞–∑—É–º–Ω–æ –Ω–µ —É–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞—é—Ç—Å—è). –ï—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ, —á—Ç–æ –≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –ø–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –ë–æ–≥–∞, –í—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ä–∞–∑—É–º–∞ –∏ –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ö –Ω–µ–º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—É—â–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —Ç–µ–º–æ–π –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è, —ç—Ç–æ - –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–µ.
–ù–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∞—è –∫—Ä–∞–π–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å - —Å–ª–µ–ø–∞—è –≤–µ—Ä–∞ –≤ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ—Ç—É, –Ω–µ–∏–∑–±–µ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∏ –≤—Å–µ–º–æ–≥—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ —ç–≤–æ–ª—é—Ü–∏–∏. –ò—Ö —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º —Ç–æ–∂–µ –Ω–∏ –≤ —á—ë–º –Ω–µ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—É–±–µ–¥–∏—Ç. –û–Ω–∏-—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞—é—Ç, –∫–∞–∫ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É–µ—Ç –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é —ç–≤–æ–ª—é—Ü–∏—é, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –∑–∞ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∏–π —Å—Ä–æ–∫ (–º–µ—Å—è—Ü—ã, –æ—Ç —Å–∏–ª—ã - –≥–æ–¥—ã) –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π —ç–≤–æ–ª—é—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –ø—É—Ç—ë–º —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å AGI. –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –∏—Ö –Ω–∏–∫—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Ö–æ—á–µ—Ç –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫ –±—ã...

–ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —è, –≤ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º, —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–µ–Ω —Å –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–º–∏ —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º–∞, —á—Ç–æ –∑–∞—Ä–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ - –∫—Ä–∞–π–Ω–µ –º–∞–ª–æ–≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ–±—ã—Ç–∏–µ. –ë–µ–∑ –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è (–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–∫–∞ –Ω–µ—Ç) –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º–æ–≤ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω—ã—Ö –ø–æ–≤—ã—Å–∏—Ç—å –≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Å–∞–º–æ—Å–±–æ—Ä–∫–∏ –º–æ–ª–µ–∫—É–ª –¥–æ —Ö–æ—Ç—å —Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ-–ª–∏–±–æ —Ä–∞–∑—É–º–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–π, –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–π–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–æ–≤–ø–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏–π –∑–∞—Ä–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–∏—Ç—å –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è.  –ò –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ–π—à–µ–µ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏–µ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ —Ç–æ–∂–µ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–æ –Ω–∞ —ç–≤–æ–ª—é—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–º –æ—Ç–±–æ—Ä–µ –Ω–∞–∏–±–æ–ª–µ–µ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º–æ–≤ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –±–µ–ª–∫–æ–≤–æ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –∏ —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–π –≤ –î–ù–ö –∏ –†–ù–ö. –ê —Å –ø–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º —Ü–∏–≤–∏–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ - –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–º–∏ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–∞–º–∏...

message : [DeepMind Gato] A Generalist Agent
Scott Reed, Konrad Zolna, Emilio Parisotto, Sergio Gomez Colmenarejo, Alexander Novikov, Gabriel Barth-Maron, Mai Gimenez, Yury Sulsky, Jackie Kay, Jost Tobias Springenberg, Tom Eccles, Jake Bruce, Ali Razavi, Ashley Edwards, Nicolas Heess, Yutian Chen, Raia Hadsell, Oriol Vinyals, Mahyar Bordbar, Nando de Freitas
–°—Ç–∞—Ç—å—è: https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.06175
–ü–æ—Å—Ç: https://www.deepmind.com/publications/a-generalist-agent 

–í –∑–æ–æ–ø–∞—Ä–∫–µ DeepMind –ø–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ. –ö —à–∏–Ω—à–∏–ª–ª–µ –∏ —Ñ–ª–∞–º–∏–Ω–≥–æ –∑–∞–≤–µ–∑–ª–∏ –∫–æ—à–∫—É.

–ù–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–º –¥–µ–ª–µ –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç –¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ–π—à–∏–π —à–∞–≥ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ Trajectory Transformer (https://t.me/gonzo_ML/726) –∏ Decision Transformer (https://t.me/gonzo_ML/719). –ò–ª–∏ –¥–∞–∂–µ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —à–∞–≥–æ–≤.

–ù–∞–ø–æ–º–Ω–∏–º, —ç—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–∏ –¥–≤–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –∑–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏–ª–∏ —Å–æ —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω—ã –∑–∞–º–µ–Ω—ã —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–Ω–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ RL –Ω–∞ sequence modeling –∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ—Ä-–¥–µ–∫–æ–¥–µ—Ä –¥–ª—è –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–µ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–π. Gato –∏–¥—ë—Ç –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ –∏ —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –º—É–ª—å—Ç–∏–º–æ–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∏ –º—É–ª—å—Ç–∏–∑–∞–¥–∞—á–Ω–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å—é, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –∫—Ä–æ–º–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á RL (–∏–≥—Ä—ã –ê—Ç–∞—Ä–∏ –∏–ª–∏ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç-–º–∞–Ω–∏–ø—É–ª—è—Ç–æ—Ä) –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å captioning –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–æ–∫ –∏–ª–∏ —á–∞—Ç–∏—Ç—å—Å—è. –ò –≤—Å—ë —ç—Ç–æ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–π –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å—é, —Å –æ–¥–Ω–∏–º –∏ —Ç–µ–º –∂–µ –Ω–∞–±–æ—Ä–æ–º –≤–µ—Å–æ–≤, —ç—Ç–æ —Ç–æ–∂–µ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏–µ –æ—Ç decision/trajectory transformer.

–í –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –ø–∞—Ä—É –ª–µ—Ç —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–µ–π ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥. –†–∞–Ω—å—à–µ –º—ã –Ω–µ –º–æ–≥–ª–∏ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏—Ç—å —Å–µ–±–µ –æ–¥–Ω—É –±–æ–ª—å—à—É—é —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à—É—é –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –Ω–∞ –≤—Å—ë (–¥–∞ –∏ –Ω–µ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∞–ª–æ—Å—å —Ç–∞–∫—É—é –æ–±—É—á–∏—Ç—å, —Ö–æ—Ç—è –ø–∏—Å–∞–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ —ç—Ç–æ –¥–∞–≤–Ω–æ, —Ç–æ—Ç –∂–µ –®–º–∏–¥—Ö—É–±–µ—Ä), –∞ –≤ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥ –≤—Å—ë –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –æ—Ç—á—ë—Ç–ª–∏–≤—ã–π. –°–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ –ø–æ—à–ª–∏ –≤–∞–ª–æ–º —É–Ω–∏–º–æ–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ (–æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã–µ) —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏, —Å–∞–º—ã–π –≥—Ä–æ–º–∫–∏–π –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä –∏–∑ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö, —ç—Ç–æ, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, GPT-3 (https://t.me/gonzo_ML/305), –Ω–µ–æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–≤—à–∞—è—Å—è —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ–π —Ä–µ—à–∞—Ç—å –∫—É—á—É —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–∞–¥–∞—á, –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –µ—ë –≤–æ–æ–±—â–µ –¥–∞–∂–µ –Ω–µ –æ–±—É—á–∞–ª–∏. –ü–æ—Ç–æ–º –ø–æ–¥—Ç—è–Ω—É–ª–∏—Å—å –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ –º–æ–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ (—Ç–æ—Ç –∂–µ CLIP –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª—Å—è –Ω–µ–æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à, https://t.me/gonzo_ML/665), –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –∏ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Å–µ—Ä—å—ë–∑–Ω—ã–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –ø–æ—à–ª–∏ (–Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, Florence, https://t.me/gonzo_ML/734) –∏–ª–∏ –≤–æ—Ç –Ω–µ–¥–∞–≤–Ω—è—è Flamingo (https://t.me/gonzo_ML/941). –ù—É –∏ –º—É–ª—å—Ç–∏–º–æ–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å (—Ç–∞ –∂–µ –§–ª–∞–º–∏–Ω–≥–æ, –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä) —Å –º—É–ª—å—Ç–∏–∑–∞–¥–∞—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é (–Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, exT5, https://t.me/gonzo_ML/761) –ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏. –ù—ã–Ω–µ—à–Ω–µ–µ —Å–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–µ –º—É–ª—å—Ç–∏–º–æ–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Å RL –º–Ω–µ –Ω—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ, –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º—É —á—Ç–æ —è –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞—é –∫–∞–∫–∏—Ö-—Ç–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–æ–∫ –ø–æ —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏ symbol grounding –∏ –≤–æ–∫—Ä—É–≥. 

–ß—Ç–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–æ, —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤ —Ü–µ–ª–æ–º —Ä–æ—Å–ª–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã—Ö —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è—Ö, –∫–∞–∫ –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á –∏ –º–æ–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π (–≤—Å—ë –ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –≤—ã—à–µ), —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –Ω–∞ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω–µ –∞—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä (–≥–¥–µ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –≤–µ–∑–¥–µ –≤ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª—Å—è —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ—Ä).  

–ú–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –Ω–µ –¥–µ–ª–∞–ª–∏ —Å—É–ø–µ—Ä-–±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–π –∏ —Ç—è–∂—ë–ª–æ–π, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –≤ —Ä–∏–ª—Ç–∞–π–º–µ –Ω–∞ —Ç–µ–∫—É—â–µ–º –∂–µ–ª–µ–∑–µ. –ù–æ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–π —à–∞–≥, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –æ—á–µ–≤–∏–¥–µ–Ω, –Ω–∞–¥–æ –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ–±–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –æ—Ç—Å–∫–µ–π–ª–∏—Ç—å –∏ –ø–æ—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å —á—Ç–æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ—è–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è.

–¢–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏, Gato ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ—Ä-–¥–µ–∫–æ–¥–µ—Ä –Ω–∞ 1.18B –ø–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–≤, 24 —Å–ª–æ—è, —ç–º–±–µ–¥–¥–∏–Ω–≥ –≤ 2048 –∏ feed-forward —Å–ª–æ–π –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ self-attention –≤ 8192.

–ü–æ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫—É —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ–º —Å —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ—Ä–æ–º, –≤—Å–µ –º–æ–¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞–¥–æ —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å. –¢–µ–∫—Å—Ç —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ SentencePiece —Å–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞—Ä—ë–º 32–ö; –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–∫–∏ –≤ –ø–∞—Ç—á–∏ 16x16 –∫–∞–∫ –≤ ViT (https://t.me/gonzo_ML/434) –∏ –∑–∞—Ç–µ–º –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –ø–∏–∫—Å–µ–ª –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª–∏–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –¥–∏–∞–ø–∞–∑–æ–Ω [-1, 1] –∏ –¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ä–µ–Ω—å –∏–∑ —Ä–∞–∑–º–µ—Ä–∞ –ø–∞—Ç—á–∞; –¥–∏—Å–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ —Ç–∏–ø—É –Ω–∞–∂–∞—Ç–∏–π –Ω–∞ –∫–Ω–æ–ø–∫–∏ –≤ Atari –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–µ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑—É—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ü–µ–ª—ã—Ö —á–∏—Å–µ–ª, –∞ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–Ω—ã–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç–∏–ø–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–ø—Ä–∏–æ—Ü–µ–ø—Ü–∏–∏ –∏–ª–∏ –∫—Ä—É—Ç—è—â–∏—Ö –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ —Å–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ mu-law encoding –ø—Ä–∏–≤–æ–¥—è—Ç—Å—è –∫ –¥–∏–∞–ø–∞–∑–æ–Ω—É [-1, 1], –∞ –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º —Ä–∞–≤–Ω–æ–º–µ—Ä–Ω–æ –¥–∏—Å–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–∏–∑—É—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ 1024 –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏—è. –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω —ç–º–±–µ–¥–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è —Å–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –ø–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–µ–π, –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–æ—á–Ω—ã–µ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –±–ª–æ–∫ —Ä–µ–∑–Ω–µ—Ç–∞, –∞ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –æ–±—É—á–∞–µ–º—É—é look-up table. –ö —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç—É –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç—Å—è –æ–±—É—á–∞–µ–º—ã–µ –ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —ç–Ω–∫–æ–¥–∏–Ω–≥–∏.

–ú–æ–¥–µ–ª—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–µ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ, —Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–∏–π —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω –ø–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ã–¥—É—â–∏–º. –°–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —Ü–µ–ª–µ–≤—ã–º–∏ —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω–∞–º–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–∏—è –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞—Ç—å —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω—ã —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã—Ö, –¥–∏—Å–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –∏ –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–µ—Ä—ã–≤–Ω—ã—Ö –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–π. –ö–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–æ—á–Ω—ã–µ —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω—ã –∏ —Ç–æ–∫–µ–Ω—ã –Ω–∞–±–ª—é–¥–µ–Ω–∏–π –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è (–Ω–µ —É—á–∏—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ loss), –Ω–æ –Ω–∞ –±—É–¥—É—â–µ–µ —ç—Ç–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω–∞—è —Ç–µ–º–∞ (–ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç—Å—è –≥–∏–±—Ä–∏–¥ —Å —á–µ–º-—Ç–æ —Ç–∏–ø–∞ Dreamer?).

message : Causal Inference in ML –≤ —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–µ

–° 2019 –≥. –º—ã —Å –î–∏–º–æ–π –ö–æ–ª–æ–¥–µ–∑–µ–≤—ã–º –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–π Data Fest –ø—Ä–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏–º —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –ø–æ Interpretable ML –∏ Causal Inference in ML. –ò —Å 2019 –≥. —ç—Ç–∏ —Ç—Ä–µ–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –ª—É—á—à–∏–º–∏ –ø–æ –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∞–º –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏. 
–ú–Ω–æ–≥–∏–µ –∏–∑ –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥–æ–≤ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö —Å–µ–∫—Ü–∏–π —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –æ–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Å–ø–∏—Å–∫–µ –ª—É—á—à–∏—Ö.

Interpretable ML Track - 2019, 2020
Causal Inference in ML Track - 2020
Interpretable & Causal ML Track 2021

–°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏–ª–∞ –ø–æ—Å—ã–ª–∫—É —Å –Ω–∞–≥—Ä–∞–¥–∞–º–∏ –æ—Ç –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–≤ Data Fest - —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ Open Data Science –∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ Data Souls. –î–æ–µ—Ö–∞–ª–∏ –Ω–∞–≥—Ä–∞–¥—ã –∑–∞ 2020-2021 –≥–≥.

–û—á–µ–Ω—å —Ä–∞–¥—ã –≤–∏–¥–µ—Ç—å —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ. 
–≠—Ç–æ –≤–¥–æ—Ö–Ω–æ–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç –¥–≤–∏–≥–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ!

–í—Å–µ–º —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–µ–≥–æ –≤—Ö–æ–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ —Ç—Ä—É–¥–æ–≤—ã–µ –±—É–¥–Ω–∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –º–∞–π—Å–∫–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤!
–°–∫–æ—Ä–æ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ –∞–Ω–æ–Ω—Å—ã –∏ –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –æ—Ç Reliable ML.

Stay tuned!

message : –ê—Ä—Ö–∏—Ç–µ–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏:
[Classics] The Architecture of Complexity (1962)

   Herbert A. Simon
Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society
Vol. 106, No. 6 (Dec. 12, 1962), pp. 467-482

A number of proposals have been advanced in recent years for the development of "general systems theory" which, abstracting from properties peculiar to physical, biological, or social systems, would be applicable to all of them. We might well feel that, while the goal is laudable, systems of such diverse kinds could hardly be expected to have any nontrivial properties in common. Metaphor and analogy can be helpful, or they can be misleading. All depends on whether the similarities the metaphor captures are significant or superficial.

Read the full article at: www.jstor.org (https://unam.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=0eb0ac9b4e8565f2967a8304b&id=27b809fac6&e=634e222c4d)

Also at https://unam.us4.list-manage.com/track/click?u=0eb0ac9b4e8565f2967a8304b&id=e0e72f1670&e=634e222c4d

While it is unlikely that DNA could be formed in a meteorite, this discovery demonstrates that these genetic parts are available for delivery and could have contributed to the development of the instructional molecules on early Earth. The discovery, by an international team with NASA researchers, gives more evidence that chemical reactions in asteroids can make some of life‚Äôs ingredients, which could have been delivered to ancient Earth by meteorite impacts or perhaps the infall of dust.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 6000372069507902988, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'meteordeliverorganics.png\nConceptual image of meteoroids delivering nucleobases to ancient Earth. The nucleobases are represented by structural diagrams with hydrogen atoms as white spheres, carbon as black, nitrogen as blue and oxygen as red.'}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'NASA Goddard/CI Lab/Dan Gallagher'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'All DNA and RNA, which contains the instructions to build and operate every living being on Earth, contains five informational components, called nucleobases. Until now, scientists scouring extraterrestrial samples had only found three of the five. However, a recent analysis by a team of scientists led by Associate Professor Yasuhiro Oba of Hokkaido University, Hokkaido, Japan, identified the final two nucleobases that have eluded scientists.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Nucleobases belong to classes of organic molecules called purines and pyrimidines, which have a wide variety. However, it remains a mystery why more types haven‚Äôt been discovered in meteorites so far.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúI wonder why purines and pyrimidines are exceptional in that they do not show structural diversity in carbonaceous meteorites unlike other classes of organic compounds such as amino acids and hydrocarbons,‚Äù said Oba, lead author of a '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'paper about the research'}, 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-022-29612-x', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' published April 26 in Nature Communications. ‚ÄúSince purines and pyrimidines can be synthesized in extraterrestrial environments, as has been demonstrated by our own study, one would expect to find a wide diversity of these organic molecules in meteorites.‚Äù'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúWe now have evidence that the complete set of nucleobases used in life today could have been available on Earth when life emerged,‚Äù\xa0said Danny Glavin, a co-author of the paper at NASA‚Äôs Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'This newly discovered pair of nucleobases, cytosine and thymine, have been elusive in previous analyses likely because of their more delicate structure, which may have degraded when scientists previously extracted samples. In the earlier experiments, scientists created something of a ‚Äúmeteorite tea,‚Äù placing grains of meteorite in a hot bath to let the molecules on the sample extract into the solution and then analyzed the molecular makeup of the extraterrestrial broth.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúWe study these water extracts since they contain the good stuff, ancient organic molecules that could have been key building blocks for the origin of life on Earth,‚Äù said Glavin.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Because of how delicate these two nucleobases are, the team was initially skeptical to see them in the samples. But two factors may have contributed to the new discovery: first, the team used cool water to extract the compounds instead of hot formic acid ‚Äî which is very reactive and could have destroyed these fragile molecules in previous samples. Second, more sensitive analytics were employed that could pick up on smaller amounts of these molecules.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúThis group has managed a technique that is more like cold brew than hot tea and is able to pull out more delicate compounds,‚Äù said Jason Dworkin, a co-author of the paper at NASA Goddard. ‚ÄúI was amazed that they had seen cytosine, which is very fragile.‚Äù\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The finding doesn‚Äôt provide a smoking gun as to whether life on Earth got an assist from space or came about exclusively in the prebiotic soup in the planet‚Äôs infancy. But completing the set of nucleobases that make up life today, in addition to other molecules found in the sample, gives scientists who are trying to understand the beginning of life more compounds to experiment with in the lab.\xa0'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúThis is adding more and more pieces; meteorites have been found to have sugars and bases now,‚Äù Dworkin said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs exciting to see progress in the making of the fundamental molecules of biology from space.‚Äù'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Not only did this analysis add to the kit for those modeling the inception of life on Earth, it also provides a proof of concept for a more effective technique to extract information from asteroids in the future, especially from the samples of Bennu making their way to Earth in the next year via NASA‚Äôs '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'OSIRIS-REx mission'}, 'url': 'https://www.nasa.gov/osiris-rex', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.\xa0'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The research was supported by JSPS KAKENHI Grant Numbers JP21H04501, JP21H05414, JP20H02019, 21KK0062, 21J00504, JP20H00202 and JP20H05846; NASA Astrobiology Institute through award 13-13NAI7-0032 to the Goddard Center for Astrobiology, NASA‚Äôs Planetary Science Division Internal Scientist Funding Program through the Fundamental Laboratory Research (FLaRe) work package at NASA Goddard, and a grant from the Simons Foundation (SCOL award 302497). Non-Axiomatic Reasoning can explain some of these cognitive abilities and provides a roadmap for cognitive enhancements based on psychological and neuroscientific insights. Furthermore, we will see how advancing this kind of reasoning and combining it with state-of-the-art Deep Learning models for perception allows applying the system in real environments, with the goal to enhance the autonomy of robots where human intervention is to be kept at a minimum. Finally, we will discuss how this will allow to more robustly perform tasks such as inspection and maintenance operations of city infrastructure such as power plants, which will ultimately lead to new technology for digitization which can help to solve environmental and societal problems.', 'photo': {'_': 'Photo', 'id': 6024695538752007627, 'access_hash': 173073675115664281, 'file_reference': b'\x00b\xdc\xfb\x17\xacac\x1e\xc2%\x9chS\xb5\x0c\x8d\xa0\xf3q\xbc', 'date': datetime.datetime(2022, 5, 5, 12, 19, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'sizes': [{'_': 'PhotoStrippedSize', 'type': 'i', 'bytes': b'\x01\x1e(\xae4i\xc8\x07\xcd\x84g\xd5\x8f\xf8Q\xfd\x8d?\xfc\xf5\x83\xfe\xfa?\xe1[\xf1\x8f\xdd\xaf\xd0R\x9czP\x06\x0f\xf6\x1d\xcf\xf7\xe1\xfc\xcf\xf8Q\xfd\x87s\xfd\xf8\x7f3\xfe\x15\xb6\x8eK\x10h\x1f\xeb\xd8\x7f\xb2?\x99\xa0\x0en\xf2\xc2[5S#!\r\xc0\xdaM\x15\xa9\xad\xc4\xf2\xc7\x10A\x9c\x12O8\xa2\x804\xa3\xff\x00V\xbfAC\x1a\xe5~\xd7r\x07\x17\x12\xff\x00\xdff\x8f\xb6]\x7f\xcf\xcc\xdf\xf7\xd9\xa0\x0e\x99\x0f?\xfdjr\xe7\xcec\xfe\xc8\xfef\xb9\x7f\xb6]\x7f\xcf\xcc\xdf\xf7\xd9\xa3\xed\x97_\xf3\xf37\xfd\xf6h\x03W\xc4\x1f\xea\xa1\xfa\x9a+\x1eI\xa5\x97\x89$w\xc7M\xccN(\xa0\x0f'}, {'_': 'PhotoSize', 'type': 'm', 'w': 320, 'h': 240, 'size': 8216}, {'_': 'PhotoSizeProgressive', 'type': 'x', 'w': 640, 'h': 480, 'sizes': [2295, 5099, 10931, 14770, 20595]}], 'dc_id': 4, 'has_stickers': False, 'video_sizes': []}, 'embed_url': 'https://www.youtube.com/embed/wLftx_srsMI', 'embed_type': 'iframe', 'embed_width': 640, 'embed_height': 480, 'duration': None, 'author': None, 'document': None, 'cached_page': None, 'attributes': []}}

message : –ß—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ Reliable ML?

–ù–∞—Å—Ç–∞–ª–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–∏—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ –±—ã–ª–æ –∑–∞–¥—É–º–∞–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∫–∞–Ω–∞–ª–∞. –ö–æ–Ω—Ü–µ–ø—Ü–∏—è Reliable ML ‚Äì —ç—Ç–æ –æ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ –¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã data science/big data –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥ –±—ã–ª, –≤–æ-–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã—Ö, –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏–º –≤ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏-–∑–∞–∫–∞–∑—á–∏–∫–∞, –∞, –≤–æ-–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö, –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–æ—Å–∏–ª —ç—Ç–æ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É. 

–ß—Ç–æ –¥–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ? 

- –£–º–µ—Ç—å —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å –≥—Ä–∞–º–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–π –ø–ª–∞–Ω –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∞, —É—á–∏—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—â–∏–π –¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ–π—à–µ–µ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏. –î–ª—è —Ç–∞–∫–∏—Ö –ø–æ—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –≤–≤–æ–¥–∏–º —Ç–µ–≥ #planning

- –†–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–∞—Ç—å –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥—ã, –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≥–Ω–æ–∑ –∏ –Ω–∞ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–∞—Ä–∞–º–µ—Ç—Ä–∞–º–∏ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –≤ –¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ–π—à–µ–º –¥–ª—è –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –µ–µ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∞ (–Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø–µ—Ä–∏–æ–¥–æ–º –∏ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–º–æ-–∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –¥–ª—è –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤—ã—Ä—É—á–∫–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏). –î–ª—è –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π —Ü–µ–ª–∏ ‚Äì –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–µ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≥–æ—Ä–∞–∑–¥–æ —á–∞—â–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–≥–Ω–æ–∑–∞ ‚Äì –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ –æ—Ä–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∞—Ö –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω–Ω–æ-—Å–ª–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞. –û —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω–Ω–æ-—Å–ª–µ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑, —á–µ–º –æ–Ω –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –æ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–π –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–ª—è—Ü–∏–∏, –∑–∞—á–µ–º –∏ –∫–∞–∫ –µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—è—Ç—å –≤ DS-–∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∞—Ö, –º—ã —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ–º –≤–∞–º –ø–æ–¥ —Ç–µ–≥–æ–º #causal_inference

- –ü—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å –≤–∑–≤–µ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –æ –¥–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ–π—à–µ–º —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞ –∏ –µ–≥–æ –ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤–æ–º —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–µ. –î–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω –ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞ –¥–ª—è –≤–∞—à–µ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏, –Ω–æ –∏ –∑–∞—Ç–µ–º —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω—É—é —Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏—Å—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫—É—é –æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∫—É —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∞ –ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç–∞, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —Ä–∞—Å—á–µ—Ç –æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–µ–º–æ–≥–æ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∞. –û —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π —Å–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—â–µ–π —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ –º—ã –±—É–¥–µ–º —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–∞–º –ø–æ–¥ —Ç–µ–≥–æ–º #ab_testing, –æ –≤—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–∞ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–∏—Å–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏–Ω–≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–Ω–∏—Ü–∏–∞—Ç–∏–≤ ‚Äì –ø–æ–¥ —Ç–µ–≥–∞–º–∏ #investment_process

- –£–º–µ—Ç—å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–ø—Ä–µ—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –∏ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –∫–∞–∫ –¥–ª—è —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã, —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –¥–ª—è –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è (–±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–∞). –î–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –º—ã —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ–º –≤–∞–º –æ–± –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–ø—Ä–µ—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏. –¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –≤—Å–µ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—ã –ø–æ Interpretable ML –±—É–¥—É—Ç –ø–æ–º–µ—á–µ–Ω—ã —Ç–µ–≥–æ–º #interpretable_ml

- –£–º–µ—Ç—å –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –∫–æ—Ä—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–Ω—ã–µ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–∏ –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –¥–ª—è —Ä–µ—à–∞–µ–º–æ–π –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏, –Ω–æ –∏ —Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å-–º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–∏, —Å–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–º –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏, —Å–≤—è–∑–∞—Ç—å –∏—Ö —Å —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ –º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏ –∏—Ç–æ–≥–æ–≤—ã–º —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤—ã–º —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–º –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏. –¢—É—Ç —Ç–µ–≥ –¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ –æ—á–µ–≤–∏–¥–Ω—ã–π - #metrics

–ò—Ç–∞–∫, –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ–ø—Ü–∏—è Reliable ML –æ—Ö–≤–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ ML (#tech), –Ω–æ –∏ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã DS –∏ –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è —Å –±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–æ–º (#business) –¥–ª—è –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∞. 

Stay tuned!

–†–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ü–∏—è –∏–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è ¬´–õ–µ–Ω—Ç–∞.—Ä—É¬ª –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–∞ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ AI-—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –ø—Ä–∏–∑–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—É —Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ü–∏–π –ø—Ä–∏ –ø–æ–¥–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤–∫–µ —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–æ–≤—ã—Ö –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª–æ–≤. AI-—Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω –£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –∏ –∏–Ω–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ü–∏–π –°–±–µ—Ä–∞ –ø—Ä–∏ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–∏ Sber AI –∏ ¬´–õ–µ–Ω—Ç—ã.—Ä—É¬ª.
–†–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∏–∑ —Ç—Ä–µ—Ö –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–±–ª–µ–≥—á–∏—Ç—å –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Ä—É—Ç–∏–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∏. –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç –ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞–µ—Ç –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ—Ç–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–µ—Å–Ω—ã–µ –¥–ª—è –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ —Ç–µ–º—ã, —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–∞–µ—Ç —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –Ω–æ–≤–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π. –í—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç—ã –¥–ª—è —à–∏—Ä–æ–∫–æ–≥–æ –∫—Ä—É–≥–∞ —á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π, –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ –¥–ª—è –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏—è –∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞—è —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±—ã –∏—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è. –ï—â–µ –æ–¥–∏–Ω –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç –æ—Ö–≤–∞—Ç –∏ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—è–µ–º—ã—Ö –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∞–ª–æ–≤.
–ö–∞–∫ –æ—Ç–º–µ—á–∞–µ—Ç –≤–∏—Ü–µ-–ø—Ä–µ–∑–∏–¥–µ–Ω—Ç, –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –£–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –∏ –∏–Ω–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ü–∏–π –°–±–µ—Ä–∞ –ê–ª—å–±–µ—Ä—Ç –ï—Ñ–∏–º–æ–≤, –≤–Ω–µ–¥—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ –ò–ò —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –æ–¥–Ω–∏–º –∏–∑ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–æ–≤ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—è —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –∂—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∏–∫–∏.
–ü–æ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ ¬´–õ–µ–Ω—Ç—ã.—Ä—É¬ª –∏ –¥–∏—Ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ –ø–æ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—é –º–µ–¥–∏–∞ Rambler&Co –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä–∞ –¢–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤–∞, —Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ —Å –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–æ–π –°–±–µ—Ä–∞ —É–¥–∞–ª–æ—Å—å —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å ¬´–ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞–µ—Ç –ø–æ–≤—ã—Å–∏—Ç—å –∫–∞—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∏ –æ–ø–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫—É–µ–º–æ–π –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —É–ª—É—á—à–∏—Ç—å –µ–µ –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–µ –∞—É–¥–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–µ–π¬ª. –û–Ω –ø–æ—è—Å–Ω–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç –∞–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ü–∏–∏, –∏ —Å–ø–∏—Å–æ–∫ —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ ¬´–õ–µ–Ω—Ç—ã.—Ä—É¬ª, –∏–º–µ—é—â–∏—Ö –∫ –Ω–µ–º—É –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø, —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä—è–µ—Ç—Å—è. –í –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∞—Ö ‚Äî –µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–∞—Ö –≤—Å–µ—Ö —Ñ–µ–¥–µ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –∏–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–π Rambler&Co.

{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The Consciousness Instinct: Unraveling the Mystery of How the Brain Makes the Mind'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' '}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Michael S. Gazzaniga'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' Farrar, Straus and Giroux: 2018.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In April 1648, a young admirer of Ren√© Descartes visited the French philosopher at his estate on the Dutch coast. Aiming to discuss the cardinal points of Cartesian philosophy, Frans Burman had marked more than 70 passages in Descartes‚Äôs works. How, he asked, can soul and body affect each other, given their fundamental difference? Descartes conceded that the question was thorny, but pointed to the evidence that they do ‚Äî for instance, in emotion. The mystery lies in the mechanism, and this, Descartes confided, was perhaps best left to theologians.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Neuroscientist Michael Gazzaniga tackles this abiding mind‚Äìbody problem anew in '}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The Consciousness Instinct'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '. His subtitle, '}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Unraveling the Mystery of How the Brain Makes the Mind'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', rephrases Descartes‚Äôs conundrum into a bold promise. But then, Gazzaniga is a bold scientist. He made his name in the 1960s through pioneering work on severing the connection between the brain‚Äôs left and right hemispheres (‚Äòsplit brains‚Äô), as his autobiography vividly details ('}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'D. Draaisma '}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Nature'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' '}, {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '518,'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' 298‚Äì299; 2015'}]}, 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/articles/518298a', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ').'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'His latest book is certainly evidence that scholars advancing in age (Gazzaniga is now 78) often trust themselves with ever broader scientific and philosophical questions. Thus he guides readers through neurology, biology and psychology, discussing the origin and neural underpinnings of language or the mechanism of facial recognition. And he evokes Isaac Newton‚Äôs laws of motion, the special and general theories of relativity and quantum physics ‚Äî surprisingly, for a man with a self-confessed blind spot for mathematical abstraction.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The tour yields a couple of useful lessons. With theoretical biologist Howard Pattee, Gazzaniga emphasizes that we should resist the lure of the ‚Äúsingle-explanation fallacy‚Äù ‚Äî the idea that one theory can cover everything, from our introspective sense of awareness down to the subatomic particles of brain tissue. Explanations, he asserts, should be thought of as context-dependent, just as light in quantum physics sometimes behaves like waves and sometimes like particles.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Gazzaniga defines consciousness as ‚Äúthe subjective feeling of a number of instincts and/or memories playing out in time in an organism‚Äù. He points out that clinical cases ‚Äî he spent a few years working on neurological wards ‚Äî add complexities. For instance, people who are completely unable to move can still be conscious, a frightening condition called locked-in syndrome. Consciousness might be absent in sleepwalking. Thus, coupling it to behaviour is misleading.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Nor is it straightforward to link consciousness to parts of the brain. One of Gazzaniga‚Äôs earliest findings was that disconnecting the left and right hemispheres produced two separate conscious systems; only one, usually supported by the left brain, was able to express itself in language. It had been assumed that consciousness co-evolved with the cerebral cortex, supporting ‚Äòhigher‚Äô functions such as language and reasoning. But referring to the work of neuroscientist Bj√∂rn Merker, Gazzaniga makes the case that consciousness might not be necessarily ‚Äî or exclusively ‚Äî locked into cortical and linguistic processes. In some children born with a seriously compromised forebrain, the damaged tissue gets replaced by fluid (hydranencephaly). They grow up lacking language, but still express feelings and have subjective experiences. According to Gazzaniga, consciousness might actually originate in the evolutionarily older midbrain, with the cortex providing ‚Äúa collection of extensions (apps!) to enhance conscious experiences‚Äù.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In an engaging discussion of the brain‚Äôs architecture, he offers a mundane simile for consciousness. The brain should be thought of as a multitude of modules, each specialized for a single task, such as recognizing patterns or monitoring rhythm in music. The end products of these modules rise to the surface and burst like ‚Äúbubbles in a boiling pot of water‚Äù, each a fleeting part of our awareness. Our subjective sense of continuity, described by pioneering psychologist William James as ‚Äústream of consciousness‚Äù, might be illusion: we merely experience the rapid succession of elements as a smooth movement, like the frames of a film. The metaphor of the bubbles seems first and foremost an invitation to generate a testable theory, and Gazzaniga‚Äôs observations will almost certainly provide much of the test material.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Gazzaniga ends by reflecting that the ultimate explanation for how mind emerges from meat might not prove ‚Äúwarm and cuddly‚Äù. Instead, it might vie with quantum mechanics for sheer counter-intuitive weirdness, hovering ‚Äúway beyond our intuitions and imaginations‚Äù. Once again we seem to hear what Burman heard, 370 years ago: a sigh of resignation, as Descartes indicated that it might all be better left to the theologians.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Nature '}, {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '556'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', 26-27 (2018)'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'doi: 10.1038/d41586-018-03920-z'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockRelatedArticles', 'title': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}, 'articles': [{'_': 'PageRelatedArticle', 'url': 'http://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-020-01105-1', 'webpage_id': 7937820126205467285, 'title': 'Gut pain sensors help to combat infection', 'description': 'Neurons help to defend against the spread of the bacterium Salmonella.', 'photo_id': 5831264320707734311, 'author': 'Romana R. –†–µ—á—å –∏–¥—ë—Ç –æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–º –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º–µ —Ç–∞–∫ –Ω–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ–º–æ–≥–æ –¥–æ—Ä–∞—â–∏–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–π, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –∑–∞–ø—É—Å–∫–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö —Ñ–µ–¥–µ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∞ ¬´–í–∑–ª—ë—Ç –æ—Ç —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—Ç–∞–ø–∞ –¥–æ IPO¬ª. –ï–≥–æ —Ü–µ–ª—å ‚Äì —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –ª–∏–¥–µ—Ä–æ–≤ –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –ú–µ—Ä—ã –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–∏, —É—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∂–¥—ë–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –≤ –Ω—ã–Ω–µ—à–Ω–µ–º –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–∏, —Å—Ç–∞–Ω—É—Ç –æ–¥–Ω–∏–º –∏–∑ —ç—Ç–∞–ø–æ–≤ –¥–ª—è –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è —ç—Ç–æ–π —Ü–µ–ª–∏.

Over several decades of trying and failing (badly), the original vision was largely abandoned. Nowadays almost all AI work relates to narrow, domain-specific, human-designed capabilities. Powerful as these current applications may be, they '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'are limited to their specific target domain'}, 'url': 'https://medium.com/@petervoss/why-machine-learning-wont-cut-it-f523dd2b20e3#.h0chh0j09', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', and have very narrow (if any) adaptation or interactive learning ability. We felt that we wanted to give our community a distinctive identity, to differentiate our work from mainstream AI which is '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'unlikely to lead to general intelligence'}, 'url': 'https://medium.com/@petervoss/no-you-cant-get-from-narrow-ai-to-agi-eedc70e36e50', 'webpage_id': 3441607289267306163}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The term ‚ÄòAGI‚Äô gave a name to this emerging group of researchers, scientists, and engineers who were actually getting back to trying to develop ‚Äòreal AI‚Äô. This ‚Äòmovement‚Äô was officially launched with the publication of the book '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Artificial General Intelligence'}, 'url': 'http://www.amazon.com/Artificial-General-Intelligence-Cognitive-Technologies/dp/354023733X', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' , and has since gathered momentum with additional publications and annual AGI conferences. By now, the term has become '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'quite widely used'}, 'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_general_intelligence', 'webpage_id': 3384953263878130998}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' to refer to machines with human, or super-human level capabilities.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Some people have suggested using ‚ÄòAGI‚Äô for any work that is generally in the area of autonomous learning, ‚Äòmodel-free‚Äô, adaptive, unsupervised or some such approach or methodology. I don‚Äôt think this is justified, as many clearly narrow AI projects use such methods. One can certainly assert that some approach or technology will likely help achieve AGI, but I think it is reasonable to judge projects by whether they are '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'explicitly '}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'on a path'}]}, 'url': 'https://medium.com/@petervoss/from-narrow-to-general-ai-e21b568155b9', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' (however far away it may be) to achieving the grand vision: a single system that can learn incrementally, reason abstractly, and act effectively over a wide range of domains ‚Äî just like humans can.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Elsewhere'}, 'url': 'https://medium.com/@petervoss/on-intelligence-1714ef5693ef#.1r4jx1hv7', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' I‚Äôve elaborated on what human intelligence entails; here I want to take a slightly different angle and ask ‚ÄúWhat would it take for us to say we‚Äôve achieved AGI?‚Äù. This is my proposed descriptive definition, followed by some elaboration:'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'A computer system that matches or exceeds the real time cognitive (not physical) abilities of a smart, well-educated human.'}}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Cognitive abilities include'}}, 'url': 'https://medium.com/@petervoss/agi-checklist-30297a4f5c1f#.gkw2kcwp7', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', but are not limited to: holding productive conversations; learning new commercial and scientific domains in real time through reading, coaching, experimentation, etc.; applying existing knowledge and skills to new domains. For example, learning new professional skills, a new language (including computer languages), or even novel games.'}}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Acceptable limitations include: very limited sense acuity and dexterity.'}}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Alternative suggestions, and their merits'}}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúMachines that can learn to do any job that humans currently do‚Äù '}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äî I think this fits quite well, except that it seems unnecessarily ambitious. Machines that can do most jobs, especially mentally challenging ones would get us to our overall goal of having machines that can help us solve difficult problems like ageing, energy, pollution, and help us think through political and moral issues, etc. Naturally, they would also help to build machines that will handle remaining jobs we want to automate.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúMachines that pass the Turing Test‚Äù '}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äî The current '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Turing Test asks too much'}, 'url': 'https://medium.com/@petervoss/can-the-turing-test-confirm-agi-8cf742ea9396#.j1hzqjh4d', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' (potentially having to dumb itself down to fool judges that it is human), and too little (limited conversation time). A much better test would be to see if the AI can learn a broad range of new complex human-level cognitive skills via autonomous learning and coaching.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúMachines that are self-aware/ can learn autonomously/ do autonomous reduction/ etc.‚Äù'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' ‚Äî These definition grossly underspecify AGI. One could build narrow systems that have these characteristics (and probably have already), but are nowhere near AGI (and may not be on the path at all).'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚ÄúA machine with the ability to learn from its experience and to work with insufficient knowledge and resources.‚Äù ‚Äî Important requirements but lacking specification of the level skill one expects. Again, systems already exist that have these qualities but are nowhere near AGI.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Some objections'}}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Why specify AGI in terms of '}}, {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'human'}}}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' abilities?'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' ‚Äî While we‚Äôd expect AGI cognition to be quite different (instant access to Internet, photographic memory, logical thinking, etc.), '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'the goal is still to free us from most work'}, 'url': 'https://medium.com/@petervoss/unemployment-is-this-time-different-3547a514622c#.gqqocmv2r', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '. In order to do that it must be able to operate in our environment, and learn interactively via natural language and human interaction.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Why not require full sense acuity, dexterity, and embodiment?'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' ‚Äî I think that a reasonable relaxation of requirements is to initially exclude tasks that require high dexterity & sense acuity. The reason is that initial focus should be on cognitive ability ‚Äî ie. a ‚ÄúHelen Hawking‚Äù (Helen Keller/ Stephen Hawking)‚Äù The core problem is building the brain, the intelligence engine. It can‚Äôt be totally disconnected from the world, but its senses/ actuators do not need to be very elaborate, as long as it can operate other machines (tool use).'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockDivider'}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Peter Voss is founder of '}}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'SmartAction'}}, 'url': 'http://www.smartaction.com/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' and CEO of '}}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'AGI Innovations Inc'}}, 'url': 'http://www.agi-3.com/', 'webpage_id': 0}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Please like and share ‚Äî if you like :)'}}], 'photos': [{'_': 'Photo', 'id': 5871835548153392010, 'access_hash': 2489854671260104952, 'file_reference': b'\x00b\xdc\xfb\x17\x87\x02?\x9b+\x8d\xb8\x97PW\x9d\xc2JP\x86k', 'date': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 8, 17, 24, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'sizes': [{'_': 'PhotoStrippedSize', 'type': 'i', 'bytes': b'\x01(\x1e\xa1\x0c[\x88\xc0\xab,"\x8b\x1b\x8eN9\x02\x8bR\x02\x93\xdc\x03T\xe4\x93y=\x89\xad\x9e\x86{\xb2\xf4b\x19W\x0b\xc1\xf45RT!\xb0)\xd0E.\xf01\x8f\xc6\xae\xdc\xc0\xa1\x87\xa9\xa6\xb5#fAl@C\x83\xce*\xb0C\xbf\'\xb1\xa7A&\xc3\x93V\xd0\xa4\x88v\xaf8\xcd\x1b\x8d\xe8-\xa9\x06\\\x91E\xc4\xdb\x9f\x83L\x85\xb0\xe5zg\x8a\xab+\x9d\xe7=i\xec(\xab\xeaG\n<\xd2\x04\x8cd\xd6\xa8\x88C\x0e\xd1\xc9\xc7\'\xd6\x8a+8\xb3I-\nr\r\xb2\x1e\xdf56\xf5>u\x90tq\x9f\xc6\x8a*\xa4LO'}, {'_': 'PhotoSize', 'type': 'm', 'w': 240, 'h': 320, 'size': 27413}, {'_': 'PhotoSize', 'type': 'x', 'w': 300, 'h': 400, 'size': 42124}], 'dc_id': 4, 'has_stickers': False, 'video_sizes': []}], 'documents': [], 'part': False, 'rtl': False, 'v2': False, 'views': None}, 'attributes': []}}
