message : https://www.facebook.com/sergey.karelov.5/posts/4777361522299500
Sergey Karelov
–ú–æ–∑–≥ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ –ü—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø—É —Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω–æ–π —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏.
–Ø–ø–æ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–µ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏–µ –≤–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–æ–≤—É—é —Å—Ç–∞—Ç—å—é –≤ ¬´–∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—É—Ü–∏—é –±–∏–æ–º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∏¬ª.
–ú—ã —Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –∑–Ω–∞–µ–º, —á—Ç–æ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π –º–æ–∑–≥–∞ —Ç–∞–∫ –∏–ª–∏ –∏–Ω–∞—á–µ –ø–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π. –ò–±–æ –º–æ–∑–≥ –∂–∏–≤–æ–π. –ê –≤—Å—ë –∂–∏–≤–æ–µ (–ø–∞—Ä–¥–æ–Ω –∑–∞ –∫–∞–ª–∞–º–±—É—Ä) –∂–∏–≤–µ—Ç –ø—É—Ç–µ–º —Ç–æ–π –∏–ª–∏ –∏–Ω–æ–π —Å–∞–º–æ–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏. –ù–æ —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ –∑–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è, –∏ –∫–∞–∫–æ–≤ –µ—ë –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø, - –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∞–ª–æ—Å—å –≤–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–π —Ç–∞–π–Ω–æ–π –¥–æ —è–Ω–≤–∞—Ä—è 2022.
–ù–æ –≤–∏–¥–Ω–æ –Ω–µ –∑—Ä—è —è –µ—â–µ –¥–≤–∞ –≥–æ–¥–∞ –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–ª –ü—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø —Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω–æ–π —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏ (–ü–°–≠) ¬´–∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—É—Ü–∏–µ–π –±–∏–æ–º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∏¬ª. –û—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏–µ, —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –≤ —è–ø–æ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–º –¶–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–µ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π –º–æ–∑–≥–∞ RIKEN, –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–æ, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å–µ—Ç–∏ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –µ–¥–∏–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø—ã –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑—É–º–∞ (1).
–ü–°–≠ —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–æ–π –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—É –∏ —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –º–æ–∑–≥–∞, –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø–æ–ª–∞–≥–∞—è, —á—Ç–æ –ª—é–±—ã–µ –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –≤ –º–æ–∑–≥–µ –º–∏–Ω–∏–º–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É—é—Ç —Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω—É—é —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏—é (—Ç.–µ. –æ—à–∏–±–∫—É –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–∏–π –µ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–∏–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏). –ê–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –ü–°–≠ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É–µ—Ç –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ–ø—Ü–∏–∏ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è, –Ω–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ–º–æ–π –±–∞–π–µ—Å–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–º –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥–æ–º.
–≠—Ç–æ—Ç –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥ –∑–∞–¥–∞–µ—Ç —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–± —Ä–∞—Å—á–µ—Ç–∞ –≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Å–æ–±—ã—Ç–∏—è, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω–æ–π –Ω–æ–≤–∞—è –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è (—Ç. –µ. –Ω–æ–≤—ã–π —Å–µ–Ω—Å–æ—Ä–Ω—ã–π –≤–≤–æ–¥). –ê–≥–µ–Ω—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ –Ω–æ–≤—ã—Ö –ø–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞—é—â–∏—Ö —Å–µ–Ω—Å–æ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö, —Å —É—á–µ—Ç–æ–º –æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª—ã—Ö —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –∏ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–æ –∏—Ö –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–≤. 
–Ø–ø–æ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–µ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–ª–∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Å–µ—Ç—å—é –∑–∞–¥–∞—á—É –Ω–∞—É—á–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—å –ª–∞–±–∏—Ä–∏–Ω—Ç. –í —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–µ –æ–Ω–∏ –æ–±–Ω–∞—Ä—É–∂–∏–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ —Å–µ—Ç—å —Å–∞–º–æ–æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è, –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω—è—è —Å–∏–ª—É —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–≤—è–∑–µ–π –∏ —Å–≤—è–∑—ã–≤–∞—è –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª—ã–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å –±—É–¥—É—â–∏–º–∏ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∞–º–∏. –ü—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —Å–µ—Ç—å —Å–º–æ–≥–ª–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–π—Ç–∏ –ª–∞–±–∏—Ä–∏–Ω—Ç –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ–± –∏ –æ—à–∏–±–æ–∫ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏—Å—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–º.
–ü–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å —Ñ–∏–∑–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π —Å–º—ã—Å–ª –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ—â–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ –Ω–∞ —Ñ–∏–∑–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏.
‚Ä¢ –î–ª—è –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏—è –ø—Ä–µ–≤—ã—à–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–æ.
‚Ä¢ –ë–∏–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç —Ç–µ–ª–∞ –∏ –ø–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–æ—ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º–∏.
‚Ä¢ –ü–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä ‚Äì —É–≤—è–∑–∫–∞ –∞–ª–ª—é—Ä–æ–≤ (–ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–≤ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∫–∏) —É –ª–æ—à–∞–¥–∏ (–∏–ª–∏ —Å–æ–±–∞–∫–∏, –∫–æ—à–∫–∏ ‚Ä¶) —Å–æ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è. –î–ª—è –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–≥–æ –∞–ª–ª—é—Ä–∞ ‚Äî —à–∞–≥–∞, —Ä—ã—Å–∏ –∏–ª–∏ –≥–∞–ª–æ–ø–∞ ‚Äî –∂–∏–≤–æ—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –≤—ã–±–∏—Ä–∞—é—Ç –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é, –Ω–∞–∏–±–æ–ª–µ–µ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–æ—ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—É—é –¥–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—å 
‚Ä¢ FYI –í–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è —à–∞–≥–æ–º —Ä–∞—Å—Ö–æ–¥ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏ –≤ 5-6 —Ä–∞–∑ –≤—ã—à–µ, —á–µ–º –≤ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–∏ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–∫–æ—è, –∞ –ø—Ä–∏ —Ä–µ–∑–≤–æ–π —Ä—ã—Å–∏ ‚Äì —Ä–∞—Å—Ö–æ–¥ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏ –≤ 60 –∏ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —Ä–∞–∑ –≤—ã—à–µ.
–ó–∞—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç—ã —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏ —Å–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ —É–≤–µ–ª–∏—á–∏–≤–∞—é—Ç—Å—è (—Å–º. —Ä–∏—Å. (2)) ‚Äî –ø–æ –º–µ—Ä–µ —É–≤–µ–ª–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–º —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ ¬´–ø–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∫–∏¬ª, –∞ –∑–∞—Ç–µ–º, –ø—Ä–∏ —Å–º–µ–Ω–µ –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∫–∏ —Å —à–∞–≥–∞ –Ω–∞ —Ä—ã—Å—å, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ —Å —Ä—ã—Å–∏ –Ω–∞ –≥–∞–ª–æ–ø, ‚Äî —É–º–µ–Ω—å—à–∞—é—Ç—Å—è. –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ö–æ–¥ —Å–Ω–∏–∂–∞–µ—Ç –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∑–∞—Ç—Ä–∞—á–∏–≤–∞–µ–º—ã—Ö —É—Å–∏–ª–∏–π: –º–µ–¥–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è —Ä—ã—Å—å —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç –º–µ–Ω—å—à–µ —É—Å–∏–ª–∏–π, —á–µ–º –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä—ã–π —à–∞–≥; –∞ –º–µ–¥–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –≥–∞–ª–æ–ø –º–µ—Ç–∞–±–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –¥–µ—à–µ–≤–ª–µ –±—ã—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π —Ä—ã—Å–∏. –ü—Ä–∏—á–µ–º –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –ø–∞—Ç—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω –ø–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∫–∏ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–µ—Ç –æ–¥–Ω–æ –∏ —Ç–æ –∂–µ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏ –∫ —Ä–∞—Å—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏—é (–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä–Ω–æ 300 –¥–∂–æ—É–ª–µ–π –Ω–∞ –º–µ—Ç—Ä).
–ê–Ω–∞–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–Ω—ã–º –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–º –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å–µ—Ç–∏ –º–æ–∑–≥–∞ –æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã –¥–ª—è –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–µ–Ω–∏—è —ç—Ñ—Ñ–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∞—á–µ–π –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏, —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω—è—è –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –∞–¥–∞–ø—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –∏ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –º–µ–Ω—è—é—â–∏—Ö—Å—è —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏—è—Ö –ø—É—Ç–µ–º —Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é –ü–°–≠ ‚Äì —Ç.–µ. –º–∏–Ω–∏–º–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É—è —Å—é—Ä–ø—Ä–∏–∑—ã –≤ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–∏—è—Ö —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏.
–≠—Ç–æ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞–µ—Ç —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ –¥–ª—è –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ç–æ–≥–æ, –∫–∞–∫ –º–æ–∑–≥ —Å–∞–º–æ–æ–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç—Å—è.
¬´–ù–∞—à–∞ —Ç–µ–æ—Ä–∏—è –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ —Å–Ω–∏–∑–∏—Ç—å —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è —Å–∞–º–æ–æ–±—É—á–∞—é—â–µ–≥–æ—Å—è –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–º–æ—Ä—Ñ–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±–æ—Ä—É–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–∞–∑–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç–∏–ø–æ–≤ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á, —á—Ç–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ –¥–ª—è –ò–ò —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–∫–æ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è¬ª , ‚Äî —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª –≤–µ–¥—É—â–∏–π –∞–≤—Ç–æ—Ä –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –¢–∞–∫—É—è –ò—Å–æ–º—É—Ä–∞.
–¢–∞–∫ —á—Ç–æ, –º–æ–∏–º —á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç–µ–ª—è–º –µ—Å—Ç—å —Å–º—ã—Å–ª –ø–µ—Ä–µ—á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç—å –º–æ–π –ª–æ–Ω–≥—Ä–∏–¥ ¬´–ö–æ–Ω—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—É—Ü–∏—è –±–∏–æ–º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∏. –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–æ–π –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –∏ —Ä–∞–∑—É–º–∞¬ª (3)

–ù–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ www.OpenTalks.AI —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–µ–º –º–∞–ª–µ–Ω—å–∫—É—é —Å–µ—Å—Å–∏—é —Å–æ–≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ —Å @AGIRussia 17.02 –≤ 17:45

–¢–µ–º–∞ —Å–µ—Å—Å–∏–∏: –ú–æ—Ç–∏–≤–∞—Ü–∏—è —É —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞ –∏ AGI
–î–≤–∞ –¥–æ–∫–ª–∞–¥—á–∏–∫–∞:
–ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞–Ω–¥—Ä –ü–∞–Ω–æ–≤, —Ñ–∏–∑–∏–∫, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –≤—á–µ—Ä–∞ –ø—Ä–æ –º–æ—Ç–∏–≤–∞—Ü–∏—é –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª
–ò–≥–æ—Ä—å –í–∞–ª–µ—Ä—å–µ–≤–∏—á –ü—É–¥–∏–∫–æ–≤, –ø—Å–∏—Ö–∏–∞—Ç—Ä

–ë–µ–≥–∞—é—â–∏–º–∏, –ø—Ä—ã–≥–∞—é—â–∏–º–∏ –∏ —Ç–∞–Ω—Ü—É—é—â–∏–º–∏ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∞–º–∏ —É–∂–µ –º–∞–ª–æ –∫–æ–≥–æ —É–¥–∏–≤–∏—à—å. –ù–æ –≤–æ—Ç —á—Ç–æ–± —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç—É –±—ã–ª–∏ –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã –ª—é–±—ã–µ –∞–ª–ª—é—Ä—ã - –æ—Ç –≥–∞–ª–æ–ø–∞ –∏ —Ä—ã—Å–∏ –¥–æ —Ç—ë–ª—å—Ç–∞ –∏ –ø–∞—Å–æ —Ñ–∏–Ω–æ, - —ç—Ç–æ —á—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ. 
–ù–æ —ç—Ç–æ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ø—Ä–∏—Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∞ —Ü–∏–∫–ª–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π. 
–ê —Å–∫–∞–∑–∫–∞ –≤–ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏ ‚Äì —É–º–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∞ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è—Ç—å –∞—Ü–∏–∫–ª–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –¥–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è, —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É—é—â–∏–µ —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∫–æ–æ—Ä–¥–∏–Ω–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –≤—Å–µ—Ö –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –∏ —Ç–µ–ª–∞.
–í–æ—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä –≤ —Å—Ç–∏–ª–µ –î–∂–µ–∫–∏ –ß–∞–Ω–∞ - —É–¥–∞—Ä –≤ –ø—Ä—ã–∂–∫–µ –ø—è—Ç–∫–æ–π –≤ —É—Ö–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–∫–∞ (–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ 5 —Å–µ–∫ –≤–∏–¥–µ–æ).

In this work https://arxiv.org/pdf/2201.07601.pdf , we propose a nonlinear MPC framework,  the BiConMP which can generate whole body trajectories online  by efficiently exploiting the structure of the robot dynamics.  BiConMP is used to generate various cyclic gaits on Solo12 and its performance is evaluated on different terrain, countering unforeseen pushes and transitioning online  between different gaits. Sergey Karelov
–°—É–ø–µ—Ä–æ—Ä—É–∂–∏–µ –ö–∏—Ç–∞—è –≤ –±–∏—Ç–≤–µ –∑–∞ AGI.
–ö–∏—Ç–∞–π –ø–æ—à—ë–ª –∏–Ω—ã–º –ø—É—Ç–µ–º, –Ω–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã–º –ó–∞–ø–∞–¥—É.
–ú—ã, –∫–∞–∫ –∏ –°–®–ê —Å –ï–≤—Ä–æ–ø–æ–π, –≤–∞—Ä–∏–º—Å—è –≤ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º —Å–æ–∫—É –Ω–∞—É—á–Ω—ã—Ö –∏ —Ñ–∏–ª–æ—Å–æ—Ñ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π, —Å–ª–æ–∂–∏–≤—à–∏—Ö—Å—è –Ω–∞ –ó–∞–ø–∞–¥–µ –∑–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ 300 –ª–µ—Ç. –í —ç—Ç–æ–º –∂–µ –º—É—Ç–Ω–æ–º –≤–∞—Ä–µ–≤–µ –Ω–∞—à–∏ –∏ –∑–∞–ø–∞–¥–Ω—ã–µ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –ø—ã—Ç–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –ø—Ä–æ–∑—Ä–µ—Ç—å –ø—É—Ç—å –∫ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—é –Ω–∏–∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–µ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞–≤—à–µ–≥–æ –Ω–∞ –ó–µ–º–ª–µ —Ñ–µ–Ω–æ–º–µ–Ω–∞ - –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ä–∞–∑—É–º —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π (AGI).
–ù–∞–º –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –≤ –≥–æ–ª–æ–≤—É, —á—Ç–æ —É –ö–∏—Ç–∞—è –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å —Å–≤–æ–π, —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω—ã–π –æ—Ç –∑–∞–ø–∞–¥–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—É—Ç—å –∫ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—é AGI. –ò —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –ø—É—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π –æ –º–∏—Ä–µ, –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –∏ –Ω–∞—à–∏—Ö —Ü–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è—Ö –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –∞–±—Å–æ–ª—é—Ç–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–ø–µ–Ω–¥–∏–∫—É–ª—è—Ä–µ–Ω –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é, –∏–∑–±—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–º—É –ó–∞–ø–∞–¥–æ–º.
–û–¥—É—Ä–º–∞–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –±–ª–∏–∑–∫–∏–º–∏ –∏ –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω—ã–º–∏ –Ω–∞–º –≤—ã—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ –æ—Ä–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–∞ –∑–∞–ø–∞–¥–Ω—ã–π –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥ –ò–ò-–ø–æ–ø–∑–≤—ë–∑–¥ (–Ω–∞–ø—Ä. –º–æ–π –±—ã–≤—à–∏–π –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥–∞ –ø–æ SGI –õ–∏ –ö–∞–π-–§—É ‚Äì –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∏–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —É–º, —Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∑–∞ –≥–æ–¥—ã —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ –ª—É—á—à–∏–µ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –ë–∏–≥–¢–µ—Ö–∞ –°–®–ê), –º—ã –≤—Å–µ—Ä—å–µ–∑ –¥—É–º–∞–µ–º, —á—Ç–æ –ö–∏—Ç–∞–π —Å–ª–µ–¥—É–µ—Ç —Ç–æ–º—É –∂–µ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥—É –≤ –ò–ò, —á—Ç–æ –∏ –°–®–ê.
–ê –ø—Ä–∏—Å–∫–æ—Ä–±–Ω–æ–µ –∑–∞–±–ª—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ, —á—Ç–æ –≤—Å–µ –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã–µ —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç—ã –∑–µ–º–Ω–æ–π —Ü–∏–≤–∏–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –æ–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–º, –µ—â–µ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ —É—Å—É–≥—É–±–ª—è–µ—Ç –Ω–µ–ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ó–∞–ø–∞–¥–æ–º –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø—É—Ç–∏ –∫ AGI.
–ù–æ —Å–ª–∞–≤–∞ –î–∂–µ—Ñ—Ä–∏ –î–∏–Ω–≥—É, –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–æ–¥—è—â–µ–º—É –¥–ª—è –Ω–∞—Å –Ω–∞–∏–±–æ–ª–µ–µ –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã–µ –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç—ã –ø–æ –ò–ò, - –æ–Ω –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤–µ–ª ¬´–ë–∏–±–ª–∏—é –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–¥—Ö–æ–¥–∞ –∫ –ò–ò¬ª - —ç—Å—Å–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ. –ß–∂—É –°—É–Ω-–ß—É–Ω –æ —Ç–æ–º, –∫–∞–∫ –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–∞—è —Ñ–∏–ª–æ—Å–æ—Ñ–∏—è –≤–¥–æ—Ö–Ω–æ–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç –µ–≥–æ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è AGI (1).
–î–ª—è —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∫–∏: –≤ —Å–µ–Ω—Ç—è–±—Ä–µ 2020 –ß–∂—É –°—É–Ω-–ß—É–Ω –≤–æ–∑–≤—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–ª—Å—è –≤ –ö–∏—Ç–∞–π, –æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∏–≤ –∫–∞—Ñ–µ–¥—Ä—É –ö–∞–ª–∏—Ñ–æ—Ä–Ω–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—Ç–µ—Ç–∞ –≤ –õ–æ—Å-–ê–Ω–¥–∂–µ–ª–µ—Å–µ, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –≤–æ–∑–≥–ª–∞–≤–∏—Ç—å –ò–Ω—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—É—Ç –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∞ –ü–µ–∫–∏–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—Ç–µ—Ç–∞. (2)
–†–µ–∑—é–º–µ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–≤–æ.
1) –¶–µ–ª—å AGI ‚Äì –≤–æ–≤—Å–µ –Ω–µ –±–∞–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –ø—Ä–µ–≤–æ—Å—Ö–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ –≤ –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∞—Ö, —Ä–µ—à–∞–µ–º—ã—Ö –ø—É—Ç–µ–º –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π. 
–ò—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–Ω–∞—è —Ü–µ–ª—å - —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ —Å –∞–≤—Ç–æ–Ω–æ–º–Ω—ã–º –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏—è—Ç–∏–µ–º, –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º, –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—è—Ç–∏–µ–º —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π, –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º, –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∏ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏ —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å–æ–æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏—è–º, —ç—Ç–∏–∫–µ –∏ –º–æ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º —Ü–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è–º.
2) –¢–∞–∫–∏–µ –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—ã –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω—ã –æ–±–ª–∞–¥–∞—Ç—å –∞–≤—Ç–æ–Ω–æ–º–Ω—ã–º —Å–æ–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ–º –∏ –∏–º–µ—Ç—å —Ç—Ä–∏ –≤–æ–∑–∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è (–Ω–∞ –º–∏—Ä, –Ω–∞ –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å –∏ –Ω–∞ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—É —Ü–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π). –î–∞–∂–µ –µ—Å–ª–∏ —ç—Ç–∏ —Ç—Ä–∏ –≤–æ–∑–∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–∞–∑—É–º–Ω—ã—Ö –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –æ—Ç –≤–æ–∑–∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–π –ª—é–¥–µ–π, –∞–≥–µ–Ω—Ç—ã –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω—ã –±—ã—Ç—å –≤ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–∏ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è –ª—é–¥–µ–π. 
3) –í –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–∏–µ –æ—Ç —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π —ç—Ç–∏—Ö —Ç—Ä–µ—Ö —Ñ—É–Ω–¥–∞–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–æ–∑–∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–π,  —Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ñ–∏–ª–æ—Å–æ—Ñ–∞–º–∏, –º—ã—Å–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º–∏, –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Å–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª–∞–º–∏ –Ω–∞—É–∫ –∏ –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤ –∑–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ 2000 –ª–µ—Ç, —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –∏—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ AGI –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω—ã —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–≥–Ω–∏—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–µ —Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∏ –∏ –º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏, —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω—ã–µ —á–µ—Ç–∫–æ –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∑–∏—Ç—å —Ç—Ä–∏ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –≤–æ–∑–∑—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –º–∞—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ –∏ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—é—â–∏–µ –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –º—ã—Å–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å—ã –≤ –∏—Ö –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ.
4) –ú—ã –Ω–∞–¥–µ–µ–º—Å—è, —á—Ç–æ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ—ç–º—ã "–û–¥–∞ –æ –∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–æ–π —Å–∫–∞–ª–µ" –ß–∂–∞–æ –ú—ç–Ω—Ñ—É (1254‚Äî1322) ‚Äî –≤—ã–¥–∞—é—â–µ–≥–æ—Å—è –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ö—É–¥–æ–∂–Ω–∏–∫–∞, –∫–∞–ª–ª–∏–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∞, –ª–∏—Ç–µ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞ –∏ –≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—è, ‚Äî –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏—Ç –Ω–∞–º —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞—Ç—å —Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫ –∏ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –∏–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–ø—Ä–µ—Ç–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –ø—Å–∏—Ö–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –¥–µ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ –∫–ª–∞—Å—Å–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –∫–∏—Ç–∞–π—Å–∫–æ–π —Ñ–∏–ª–æ—Å–æ—Ñ–∏–∏.
5) –í –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ —Ñ—Ä–µ–π–º–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∞ –¢–µ–æ—Ä–∏—è —Ç—Ä—ë—Ö –∂–∏–∑–Ω–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –æ—Ä–±–∏—Ç: –±—ã—Ç—å –∂–∏–≤—ã–º, —Å—Ç—Ä–µ–º–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –∫ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–µ–π –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏, –≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –æ—Å–º—ã—Å–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—É—é –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å. –≠—Ç–∏ 3 —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–Ω—ã —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è–º –æ—Ä–±–∏—Ç —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω–æ–≤ –≤ –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏ –∞—Ç–æ–º–∞. –í –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–µ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Å–∫–∞—á–∫–∞ –º–µ–∂–¥—É —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è–º–∏ (–æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –≤–Ω–∏–∑) –ª—é–¥–∏ –∏—Å–ø—ã—Ç—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç —ç–º–æ—Ü–∏–∏ –∏ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –∏–∑–ª—É—á–∞—Ç—å "—Å–≤–µ—Ç".
6) –¶–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏ –±—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç 2—Ö —Ç–∏–ø–æ–≤: –±–µ—Å—Å–º–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ-–±–µ—Å–∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω—ã–µ –∏ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ (–ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–º–µ—Ä—Ç–∏ –æ–Ω–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∞–¥–∞—é—Ç –≤ "—á–µ—Ä–Ω–æ–π –¥—ã—Ä–µ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏").
7) –ò—Ö –æ–±—ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–≥—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–µ–π –¥–≤—É—Ö –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ—É—Ü–∏–∞–Ω—Å–∫–∏—Ö —à–∫–æ–ª - ¬´–Ω–µ–±–µ—Å–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–æ–≤¬ª –∏ ¬´—Ä–∞–∑—É–º–∞¬ª, –æ–±—ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω—è—é—â–∏—Ö —Ñ–∏–ª–æ—Å–æ—Ñ–∏—é, –≥—É–º–∞–Ω–∏—Ç–∞—Ä–Ω—ã–µ –∏ —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–∞—É–∫–∏.

message : –ê–Ω–æ–Ω—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω—ã –¥–∞—Ç—ã –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ AGI-2022 –≤ –ü–∏—Ç–µ—Ä–µ! 

http://agi-conf.org/2022/
http://agi-conf.org/2022/call-for-papers/

We are excited to announce that AGI-22 will be held 21-24 June, 2022 as a hybrid conference, held in person in beautiful St. Petersburg, Russia, and virtually. Learning from the hybrid AGI-21 conference we will include substantially more time for remote presenters than we allotted in AGI-21.

The AGI conferences, since the first one way back in 2006, have been organized by the Artificial General Intelligence Society, in cooperation with the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI). The proceedings of AGI-22 will be published as a book in Springer‚Äôs Lecture Notes in AI series.

‚ÄúArtificial General Intelligence‚Äù

To understand the meaning and importance of the AGI conference series, recall that the original goal of the AI field, when it was founded in the  middle of the previous century, was the construction of ‚Äúthinking machines‚Äù ‚Äì  computer systems with human-like general intelligence. Due to the difficulty of this task, for the last few decades the majority of AI researchers have focused on what has been called ‚Äúnarrow AI‚Äù ‚Äì the production of AI systems displaying intelligence regarding specific, highly constrained tasks.

In recent years, however, more and more researchers have recognized the necessity ‚Äì and feasibility ‚Äì of returning to the original goals of the field by treating intelligence as a whole. Increasingly, there is a call for a transition back to confronting the more difficult issues of ‚Äúhuman-level intelligence‚Äù and more broadly artificial general intelligence. AGI research differs from the ordinary AI research by stressing on the versatility and wholeness of intelligence, and by carrying out the engineering practice according to an outline of a system comparable to the human mind in a certain sense.

The AGI conference series has played, and continues to play, a significant role in this resurgence of research on artificial intelligence in the deeper, original sense of the term of ‚Äúartificial intelligence‚Äù. The conferences encourage interdisciplinary research based on different understandings of intelligence, and exploring different approaches.   As the  AI field becomes increasingly commercialized and well accepted, maintaining and emphasizing a coherent focus on the AGI goals at the heart of the field remains more critical than ever.

vision, unsupervised learning and even autonomous systems.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'As models increase in complexity, the ability to introspect and understand why a model made a particular prediction has become more and more difficult. It has also become more important, as ML models make predictions that increasingly influence important aspects of our lives ‚Äî from the outcome of home loan applications to job interviews, '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'medical treatment'}, 'url': 'https://www.wsj.com/articles/medical-records-data-offers-doctors-hope-of-better-patient-care-11638543613', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' or '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'even incarceration decisions'}, 'url': 'https://www.technologyreview.com/2019/01/21/137783/algorithms-criminal-justice-ai/', 'webpage_id': 6712606879606331421}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Explainability '}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'is a technique designed to determine which model feature or combination of features led to a specific model decision.'}, {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' '}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'For example, did a model decide that an animal was specifically a labrador because of the eyes? Nose? Ears? Or was it a combination of sorts?'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5919051231739882781, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Image credit:'}, 'url': 'https://nbviewer.org/url/arteagac.github.io/blog/lime_image.ipynb#Interpretable-Machine-Learning-with-LIME-for-Image-Classification', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' Interpretable Machine Learning with LIME for Image Classification'}]}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'A machine learning model might deliver an answer based on a seemingly unjustified interpretation. To understand '}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'why'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' an inference is given, explainability approaches are used. This allows model builders to improve the models in more intentional and programmatic ways to produce desired results or to regulate standards. It‚Äôs worth noting, however, that explainability does not explain how the model works ‚Äî rather, it offers a rationale to interpret human-understandable responses.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The goal of this piece is to highlight different explainability methods and demonstrate how to incorporate them into popular ML use cases.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Explaining Explainable AI'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In the area of machine learning, deep learning models are used to make complex predictions and decisions. These advanced models generate incredible findings for a variety of domains, however, they have been nicknamed ‚Äúblack boxes‚Äù due to the opaque nature of their internal workings. It is therefore incredibly difficult for an engineer to trace back the root cause of a prediction, which is where ML explainability methods and technologies come into play.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In the case of predicting house prices based on a set of features, explainability triages and normalizes the importance of various features (square feet, number of bedrooms, zip code, last sale price, etc.) to a prediction of a home sales price.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5916796889305558330, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Model explainability example image by author (Arize AI)'}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'What Are the Different Approaches for ML Explainability?'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'There are different approaches for explainability that teams might use based upon the use case and environment. These are normally driven by:'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockList', 'items': [{'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Model Type: neural network, tree, image-based, or language-based'}}, {'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Whether or not your team has direct access to the model'}}, {'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The speed versus accuracy trade-off'}}, {'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Computational costs'}}, {'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Global and local feature importance'}}, {'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'AI governance, risk management and compliance needs'}}]}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TL;DR: '}}}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'explainability is a tool in the toolbox that helps teams understand the decisions made by their models and the impact those decisions have on their customers/users as well as their company‚Äôs bottom line. It is an approximation in itself, and there is no ‚Äúperfect‚Äù explainer ‚Äî each methodology has a trade-off.'}}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'After a quick overview of SHAP and LIME, we‚Äôll focus on model-specific and model-agonistic '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'explainability techniques'}, 'url': 'https://arize.com/blog/what-are-the-prevailing-explainability-methods/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'What is SHAP?'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'SHAP ('}, {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Shapley Additive exPlanations)'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' is a method used to break down individual predictions of a complex model. The purpose of SHAP is to compute the contribution of each feature to the prediction in order to identify the impact of each input. The SHAP explanation technique uses principles rooted in cooperative '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'coalitional game theory'}, 'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cooperative_game_theory', 'webpage_id': 3384953264509526831}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' to compute Shapley values. Much like how cooperative game theory originally looked to identify how the cooperation between groups of players (‚Äúcoalitions‚Äù) contributed to the gain of the coalition overall, the same technique is used in ML to calculate how features contribute to the model‚Äôs outcome. In game theory, certain players contribute more to the outcome and in machine learning certain features contribute more to the model‚Äôs prediction and therefore have a higher feature importance.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In the field of AI, these complex models benefit greatly from a proven method that is able to provide predictions for nonlinear models. The Shapley value is the average of all the marginal contributions to all possible coalitions. A data instance‚Äôs feature values operate as coalition members. The Shapley value explanation is expressed in the form of an additive approach to attribute a linear model. SHAP values not only reveal feature relevance but also whether the feature has a positive or negative influence on predictions. In the example of a fraud model below, the features ‚Äúpurpose‚Äù and ‚Äúloan amount‚Äù disproportionately help determine whether the model predicts fraud.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5919186291281472659, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Image by author (Arize AI) | '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Using explainability'}, 'url': 'https://docs.arize.com/arize/product-guides/explainability', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' in an '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'ML monitoring and observability platform'}, 'url': 'https://arize.com/ml-observability/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ': SHAP feature importance, measured as the mean absolute Shapley value'}]}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'It‚Äôs worth noting that the Kernel-based SHAP also does perturbations but these are based on background or reference datasets. A linear model is built to extract the Shapley values based on the perturbations.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'What is LIME?'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'LIME, or '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Local Interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations'}}, 'url': 'https://arxiv.org/pdf/1602.04938.pdf', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', is a technique that provides local ML explainability by approximating ‚Äúblack boxes‚Äô‚Äô with an interpretable model for each prediction. These local models are created from understanding how perturbations in a model‚Äôs inputs affect the end-prediction of the model.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'LIME attempts to understand the relationship between a particular example‚Äôs features and the model‚Äôs prediction by training a more explainable model such as a linear model with examples derived from small changes to the original input. At the end of training, the explanation can be found from the features for which the linear model learned coefficients above particular thresholds (after accounting for some normalization). The intuition behind this is that the linear model found these features to be most important in explaining the model‚Äôs prediction, and therefore for this local example you can reason about the contributions that each feature made in explaining the prediction that your model made.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Let‚Äôs imagine you have a black-box model where you only have access to the inference data and the corresponding model predictions, but not the initial training data. LIME creates a new dataset consisting of the perturbed samples and their corresponding black-box model predictions.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'On this new dataset, LIME trains an interpretable model weighted by the proximity of the sampled instances to the instances of interest. A trainable model should be a good approximation to machine learning model predictions locally, but not necessarily a good global fit.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'LIME can be used for tabular, image, or text datasets. The below example of a bowl of bread has LIME explanations for the top two classes (bagel, strawberry) for image classifications made by Google‚Äôs Inception V3 neural network. The prediction and explanation for ‚Äúbagel‚Äù are very reasonable, even if the prediction is wrong ‚Äî there are clearly no bagels since the hole in the middle is missing.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5916970427459153316, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Image credit: '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Cristoph Molnar'}, 'url': 'https://christophm.github.io/interpretable-ml-book/lime.html', 'webpage_id': 0}]}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Selecting SHAP or LIME: Feature Importance Vs. Attribution of Value'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The SHAP approach to explainability is designed to attribute an outcome ‚Äî say, a prediction of house price ‚Äî to a measured combination of features. We consider this a statistical attribution of a model‚Äôs output to a set of inputs. For example, the house‚Äôs 4,100 ft2 contributed to $1.1 million of the total house price prediction of $2.43 million.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The LIME approach generates a set of feature importances but does not tie those feature importances to exact attributions of the model output. For example, LIME can‚Äôt tell you the exact dollar amount that the contributed square footage made to the predicted housing price but it can tell you the most important feature or features to that prediction.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TL;DR: '}}}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'ML teams in industry often use both SHAP and LIME, but they use LIME to get a better explanation of a single prediction and SHAP to understand the entire model as well as feature dependencies.'}}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In terms of computational time and cost, LIME is faster than SHAP. However, while Shapley values take a long time to compute, SHAP makes it possible to compute the many Shapley values needed for global model interpretations. LIME can still be useful with tabular, text, and image data ‚Äî especially if the model is trained using uninterpreted functions. That said, since LIME approximates these models with a more interpretable model, there is a tradeoff between the complexity of LIME and the trustworthiness of LIME.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Model Type-Agnostic & Model Type-Specific Explainability Approaches'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Model-specific methods work by exploring and accessing the interior of the model, such as interpretation of regression coefficient weights or P-values \u200b\u200bin a linear model, or counting the number of times a feature is used in an ensemble tree model.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The model-agnostic method investigates the relationships between I/O pairs of trained models. They do not depend on the internal structure of the model. These methods are useful when there is no theory or other mechanism to interpret what is happening in the model.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Model Type Specific'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'What is TreeSHAP?'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5916856606530842024, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Image of Tree SHAP by author ('}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Arize AI'}, 'url': 'https://www.arize.com/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ')'}]}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TreeSHAP'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' is a fast explainer used for analyzing decision tree models in the '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Shap python library'}, 'url': 'https://github.com/slundberg/shap', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '. TreeSHAP is designed for tree-based machine learning models such as decision trees, random forests and gradient boosted trees. TreeSHAP is offered as a rapid, '}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'model-specific alternative'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' to KernelSHAP; however, it can sometimes produce unintuitive feature attributions.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Given the prevalence of XGBoost, TreeSHAP is an explainer approach heavily used in various teams. The tree explainer makes use of the structure of the tree algorithm to extract and generate SHAP values much faster than the Kernel explainer.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TL;DR:'}}}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' TreeSHAP is a great fast explainer if you have XGBoost or LightGBM.'}}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TreeSHAP calculates in polynomial time, not exponential time. The basic idea is to move all possible subsets down the tree at the same time. To calculate the single-tree forecast, you need to track the number of subsets in each decision node. This depends on the subset of parent nodes and the split function.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Neural Networks: Deep Explainer'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5917115219396635982, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The figure above depicts the working of the DeepExplainer (Deep SHAP). Image by author ('}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Arize AI'}, 'url': 'https://arize.com/resource/arize-platform-demo/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ')'}]}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TL;DR: Deep explainer '}}}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '(deep SHAP) is an explainability technique that can be used for models with a neural network based architecture. This is the fastest neural network explainability approach and is based on running a SHAP-based version of the original '}}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'deep lift algorithm'}}, 'url': 'https://papers.nips.cc/paper/2017/hash/8a20a8621978632d76c43dfd28b67767-Abstract.html', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.'}}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'A popular way to leverage SHAP values to explain predictions of deep learning models (neural networks) is with the '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'method'}, 'url': 'https://shap-lrjball.readthedocs.io/en/latest/generated/shap.DeepExplainer.html', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' DeepExplainer. DeepExplainer runs on deep learning frameworks to add explainability to neural network models by using DeepLIFT and Shapley values. DeepExplainer is an enhanced version of the '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'DeepLIFT'}, 'url': 'https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.02685', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' (Deep Learning Important FeaTures), a method for decomposing the output prediction of a neural network on a specific input by backpropagating the contributions of all neurons in the network to every feature of the input.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Lundberg and Lee, NIPS 2017, showed that the per node attribution rules in DeepLIFT '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'can be chosen'}, 'url': 'https://arxiv.org/abs/1704.02685', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' to approximate Shapley values. By integrating over many background samples, DeepExplainer (deep SHAP) estimates approximate SHAP values such that they sum up to the difference between the expected model output on the passed background samples and the current model output (f(x) ‚Äî E[f(x)]).'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Neural Networks: Expected Gradients & Integrated Gradients'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Expected and integrated gradients are both explainability techniques that can be used with neural network models.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TL;DR:'}}}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' expected gradients are a fast explainability technique useful for differentiable models; it offers different approximations than deep explainer and is slower than deep explainer. Integrated ingredients is an older local method that helps account for each individual prediction.'}}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Expected gradients'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' are a fast explainability technique useful for differentiable models. You can think of expected gradients as a SHAP-based version of integrated gradients, an older explainability technique. It extends the Shapley game-theory approach to integradients so the outputs of the feature attributions sum to the output.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Integrated gradients'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' are a technique for attributing the predictions of a classification model to input features. It can be used to visualize the relationship between input features and model predictions. It is a local method that helps account for each individual prediction. For example, in the '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Fashion MNIST dataset'}, 'url': 'https://www.tensorflow.org/datasets/catalog/fashion_mnist', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', if we take the image of a shoe, then the positive attributions are the pixels of the image which make a positive influence on the model classifying the image as a shoe. The integrated gradient method is mainly used to identify errors in the model, where corrections can be made to improve the accuracy of the model.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Linear Regression: Linear SHAP'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Linear SHAP'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' is an explainability approach designed for linear regression models. It‚Äôs model-specific and fast.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'A linear regression model predicts a target as a weighted sum of its inputs. The linearity of the learned relationship facilitates interpretation. Linear regression models have long been used by statisticians, computer scientists, and others involved in quantitative problems.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Model Type Agnostic'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'What is KernelSHAP?'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5917117611693419871, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Kernel SHAP'}, 'url': 'https://arize.com/blog/what-are-the-prevailing-explainability-methods/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' ‚Äî Slow Iterations of Inputs | Image by author ('}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Arize AI'}, 'url': 'https://arize.com/platform-overview/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ')'}]}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'KernelSHAP'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' is a slow, perturbation-based Shapley approach that theoretically works for all types of models but is rarely used by teams in the wild (at least in production).'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TL;DR:'}}}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' KernelSHAP tends to be way too slow to be used in practice extensively on anything but small data. It also tends to cause confusion among teams. When teams complain about SHAP being slow, usually it‚Äôs because they tested KernelSHAP.'}}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'KernelSHAP works by calculating the contributions of each feature value to the prediction for an instance ‚Äúx.‚Äù KernelSHAP is made up of five steps: examine coalitions, obtain a prediction for each coalition, calculate the weight for each using kernel SHAP, create a weighted linear model and return the Shapley values ‚Äúk,‚Äù the linear model‚Äôs coefficients.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'What is a Surrogate Model?'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5916859432619322729, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Working of surrogate model, courtesy of Arize AI'}, 'credit': {'_': 'TextEmpty'}}, 'url': None, 'webpage_id': None}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Surrogate model'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' is an explainability approach designed to build a transparent model off of the predictions of an actual model. The model is built in parallel with the model data. It is used when an outcome of interest cannot be easily directly measured, so a model of the outcome is used instead.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextBold', 'text': {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'TL;DR: '}}}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Surrogate model is useful if you don‚Äôt have the original model to extract SHAP; you can build a surrogate off of model decisions. It‚Äôs less ideal for regulatory use-cases as it is highly dependent on the data the model sees.'}}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockSubheader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'What is Individual Conditional Expectation (ICE)?'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Individual conditional explanation (ICE) plots visualize one line per instance to show how the instance‚Äôs prediction changes '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'when a feature changes'}, 'url': 'https://christophm.github.io/interpretable-ml-book/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Though ICE curves can uncover heterogeneous relationships, the ICE curve requires the two features to be drawn on multiple overlapping surfaces, which can be hard to read.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockPhoto', 'photo_id': 5916963641410825555, 'caption': {'_': 'PageCaption', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'ICE plot of cervical cancer probability by age. Unsupervised learning, a similar approach but without the need for human-generated labels, has also begun to gain traction in recent years.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'But there is another paradigm in AI, which has been around for decades but whose vast real-world potential is only starting to become clear: reinforcement learning.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'In reinforcement learning, the AI is not trained on historical real-world data; it is not given the ‚Äúanswer key‚Äù and told what to pay attention to, as in supervised learning. Instead, it is allowed to open-endedly explore its environment, learning about the world as it goes, guided only by a particular objective that it seeks to optimize for.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Reinforcement learning powered DeepMind‚Äôs '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'landmark'}, 'url': 'https://asiasociety.org/blog/asia/chinas-sputnik-moment-and-sino-american-battle-ai-supremacy', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ' AlphaGo triumph. –æ–Ω—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º —Å —Å–æ—Ç–Ω—è–º–∏ –∏ —Ç—ã—Å—è—á–∞–º–∏ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π; –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–æ–µ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –∏—Å—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–Ω—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è –µ–≥–æ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞—É—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ —Ä–∞—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è; –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑ –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Ç—ã –∏ –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ (—Ü–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏) –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è; –∞–≤—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–µ—Å—É—Ä—Å–æ–≤ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –æ–± –æ–±—â–µ–π –æ–Ω—Ç–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏–∏ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º –∏ —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º.

–°–Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π –ø—Ä–æ–≥–Ω–æ–∑ ‚Äì ¬´–∑–∏–º—ã –ò–ò¬ª –≤ 2022 –Ω–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç. –û–Ω–∞ –æ—Ç–∫–ª–∞–¥—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è, –∫–∞–∫ –º–∏–Ω–∏–º—É–º, –¥–æ 2023.
¬´–ë–∏–±–ª–∏—è –≤–µ—Ä—É—é—â–∏—Ö –≤ –ò–ò¬ª, –∫–∞–∫ –∏ –ì–ª–∞–≤–Ω–∞—è –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∞ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞, —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∏–∑ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä–æ–≥–æ –∏ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ç–æ–≤.
‚Ä¢ ¬´–°—Ç–∞—Ä—ã–π –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ç¬ª - –æ—Ç—á–µ—Ç –°—Ç–µ–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–¥—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞ HAI ¬´AI Index¬ª, –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫—É—é—â–µ–≥–æ –≤ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–µ –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–≥–æ –≥–æ–¥–∞ –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∏ ¬´—Å—Ç–∞—Ä–æ–≥–æ¬ª (–ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–æ–≥–æ).
‚Ä¢ ¬´–ù–æ–≤—ã–π –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ç¬ª - –æ—Ç—á–µ—Ç Tortoise ¬´The Global AI Index¬ª, –∫–∞–∫ –∏ –ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–æ ¬´–Ω–æ–≤–æ–º—É¬ª, –æ–ø–µ—Ä–µ–∂–∞–µ—Ç –≤—Å–µ—Ö, –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫—É—è –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∏ —É—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–µ–≥–æ –≥–æ–¥–∞ —É–∂–µ –≤ –¥–µ–∫–∞–±—Ä–µ.
–û–±–∞ –æ—Ç—á–µ—Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–≤–∞–Ω—ã –¥–∞—Ç—å –∫–æ–ª–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—ã –Ω–∞ –¥–≤–∞ –∫–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã—Ö –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∞:
‚úîÔ∏è –ö–∞–∫–æ–≤–æ —Ç–µ–∫—É—â–µ–µ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–µ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–¥–æ–≤ —Ä–∞–∑–≤–∏—Ç–∏—è –ò–ò
‚úîÔ∏è –ö–∞–∫–æ–≤–æ —Ç–µ–∫—É—â–µ–µ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–µ –º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–æ–π ¬´–ò–ò-–≥–æ–Ω–∫–∏¬ª —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω –ø–æ –∫–ª—é—á–µ–≤—ã–º –∏–Ω–¥–∏–∫–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∞–º.
–û–± –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∞—Ö 2020 –ø–æ –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏–∏ ¬´AI Index¬ª —è –ø–∏—Å–∞–ª –≤ –º–∞—Ä—Ç–µ (—Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é –æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—å –≤ –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–∏ (1))
–¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –∂–µ –æ–± –∏—Ç–æ–≥–∞—Ö 2021, —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–º—É ¬´The Global AI Index¬ª (2).
1. –ö–∞–∫ —É–∂–µ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–Ω–æ, - ¬´–∑–∏–º—ã –ò–ò¬ª –≤ 2022 –Ω–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç. –¢–∞–∫–æ–π –≤–ø—Ä—ã—Å–∫ –¥–µ–Ω–µ–≥ ($78 —è—Ä–¥–æ–≤ ‚Äì —Ä–æ—Å—Ç –Ω–∞ 109%) –∏ —Å–Ω–µ–≥ —Ä–∞—Å—Ç–æ–ø–∏—Ç, –∏ —Ö–æ–ª–æ–¥–∞ —Å–¥—É–µ—Ç.
2. –¢—Ä–∏ –ª–∏–¥–µ—Ä–∞ (–°–®–ê, –ö–∏—Ç–∞–π, –í–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–±—Ä–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—è), –∫–∞–∫ –Ω–µ—Å–æ–∫—Ä—É—à–∏–º—ã–µ –∞–≤–∏–∞–Ω–æ—Å—Ü—ã, –≤–æ–∑–≥–ª–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç —Ä–µ–π—Ç–∏–Ω–≥ 62 —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω –≤–æ—Ç —É–∂–µ 4–π –≥–æ–¥ (–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –ö–∏—Ç–∞–π –º–µ–¥–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞–µ—Ç –°–®–ê)
3. –ò–∑—Ä–∞–∏–ª—å –ø—Ä—ë—Ç –≤ —Ä–µ–π—Ç–∏–Ω–≥–µ –∫–∞–∫ –Ω–∞ –¥—Ä–æ–∂–∂–∞—Ö. –° 2019, –±–æ–ª–∏–¥–æ–º –ø—Ä–æ–º–µ–ª—å–∫–Ω—É–≤ –º–∏–º–æ –ì–µ—Ä–º–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –∏ –§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü–∏–∏, –ò–∑—Ä–∞–∏–ª—å –ø–æ–¥–Ω—è–ª—Å—è —Å 12 –Ω–∞ 5 –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ. –ï—â–µ –±—ã –Ω–µ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ç—å, –∏–º–µ—è 1–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–∞ –≤ –º–∏—Ä–µ: –ø–æ –¥–æ–ª–µ –í–í–ù –Ω–∞ –ù–ò–û–ö–† –∏ –ø–æ —Ñ–∏–Ω–∞–Ω—Å–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—é –ò–ò –Ω–∞ –¥—É—à—É –Ω–∞—Å–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è. –†–æ—Å—Å–∏—è, - –∞–ª—ë –≥–∞—Ä–∞–∂!
4. –ö—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏ –æ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –í—Å—ë —Å—Ç–∞–±–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ, –∫–∞–∫ –Ω–∞ –∫–ª–∞–¥–±–∏—â–µ. –î–∞–∂–µ –ø—Ä–∏–ø–æ–¥–Ω—è–ª–∏—Å—å —Å–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω 2019 —Å 33 –Ω–∞ 32 –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ, —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–≤-—Ç–∞–∫–∏ –ú–∞–ª—å—Ç—É. 
–ö —Å–æ–∂–∞–ª–µ–Ω–∏—é, —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç—ã –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏ –∑–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—Ç –º–µ–Ω—è –ø–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Ç—å —Ç–æ, —á—Ç–æ —É–∂–µ –ø–∏—Å–∞–ª 2 –≥–æ–¥–∞ –Ω–∞–∑–∞–¥ (3) 
–ú–æ–∂–Ω–æ –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å, –Ω–∞—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∏ –º–µ—Ç–æ–¥–∏–∫–∏ –æ—Ç—á–µ—Ç–æ–≤. –ù–æ —á—É–¥–µ—Å –Ω–µ –±—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –¥–∞–∂–µ –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –ò–ò. –ö–∞–∫ –Ω–∏ –æ—Ü–µ–Ω–∏–≤–∞–π, –Ω–æ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏—è –≤ –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –ò–ò —É–∂–µ –Ω–µ –≤—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –Ω–µ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –≤ –≤–æ—Å—å–º–µ—Ä–∫—É, –Ω–æ –∏ –≤ –¥–≤–∞–¥—Ü–∞—Ç–∫—É.
–ò —ç—Ç–æ –≥–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π –∏—Ç–æ–≥, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ –æ—Å–æ–∑–Ω–∞—Ç—å –≤—Å–µ–º –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –∑–∞ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—é —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–π –ò–ò —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–µ–≥–∏–∏. 
–ò–Ω–∞—á–µ –ø–æ–≥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –¥–Ω–æ –º–∏—Ä–æ–≤—ã—Ö –ò–ò –∏–Ω–¥–µ–∫—Å–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∏—Ç—Å—è –∏ –≤ –Ω–æ–≤–æ–º –≥–æ–¥—É. 
P.S. –ò –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ –∂–µ, –æ–± —ç—Ç–æ–º –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ —á–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ –ø–∏—Å–∞—Ç—å. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –Ω–µ –æ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –°–ú–ò (—Å –Ω–∏—Ö –∫–∞–∫–æ–π —Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å), —Ç–æ —Ö–æ—Ç—è –±—ã –Ω–µ–∑–∞–≤–∏—Å–∏–º—ã–º –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∞–º –∏ –∂—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç–∞–º.

8 –ª–µ—Ç —ç–∫—Å–ø–µ—Ä—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏–π —Å–ø—É—â–µ–Ω—ã –≤ —É–Ω–∏—Ç–∞–∑.
–ó–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–∏–≤—à–∞—è—Å—è –≤ –ø—è—Ç–Ω–∏—Ü—É –≤ –ñ–µ–Ω–µ–≤–µ 6-—è –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏—è –ø–æ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–∏—é –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –ö–æ–Ω–≤–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –æ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –∏–ª–∏ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–∏–¥–æ–≤ –æ–±—ã—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ—Ä—É–∂–∏—è —Ç–µ–ø–µ—Ä—å –≤–æ–π–¥–µ—Ç –≤ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—é. 
‚Ä¢ 8 –ª–µ—Ç —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–∞–ª–æ –Ω–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è —é—Ä–∏–¥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏–º—ã—Ö –º–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª –∑–∞—â–∏—Ç—ã –ª—é–¥–µ–π –æ—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ–Ω–æ–º–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å–º–µ—Ä—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ—Ä—É–∂–∏—è (—Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–æ–≤-—É–±–∏–π—Ü, –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—â–∏—Ö —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å –º–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–µ–º —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫–∞ –∏–ª–∏ –±–µ–∑ –Ω–µ–≥–æ).
‚Ä¢ –í–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∏–∑ 125 —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω –∑–∞—è–≤–∏–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ —Ö–æ—Ç—è—Ç –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–∏—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–æ–≤-—É–±–∏–π—Ü.
‚Ä¢ –°–®–ê, –†–æ—Å—Å–∏—è, –í–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–±—Ä–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ –ò–Ω–¥–∏—è –∑–∞–±–ª–æ–∫–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ.
–ú–æ—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ, —ç—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∏ –≥—É–º–∞–Ω–∏—Ç–∞—Ä–Ω—ã–µ —Ä–∏—Å–∫–∏, —Ä–∏—Å–∫–∏ –±–µ–∑–æ–ø–∞—Å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ä–∏—Å–∫–∏, –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–æ–≤-—É–±–∏–π—Ü –æ–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –¥–∞–ª–µ–∫–æ –Ω–µ —Å–∞–º—ã–º –≤–∞–∂–Ω—ã–º –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–æ–º –¥–ª—è –ö–æ–Ω–≤–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –û–û–ù.
–ö–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏—è –∑–∞–≤–µ—Ä—à–∏–ª–∞—Å—å –≤ –ø—è—Ç–Ω–∏—Ü—É –ª–∏—à—å —Ä–∞—Å–ø–ª—ã–≤—á–∞—Ç—ã–º –∑–∞—è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –æ —Ü–µ–ª–µ—Å–æ–æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ 2022 —Ä–∞—Å—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—å –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–µ–º–ª–µ–º—ã—Ö –¥–ª—è –≤—Å–µ—Ö —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω –º–µ—Ä –ø–æ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–º—É –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—É.
¬´–Ø –ø–æ–¥—É–º–∞—é –æ–± —ç—Ç–æ–º –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞¬ª, - –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–ª–∞ –≤ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–ª—É—á–∞—è—Ö –≥–µ—Ä–æ–∏–Ω—è ¬´–£–Ω–µ—Å–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–µ—Ç—Ä–æ–º¬ª –°–∫–∞—Ä–ª–µ—Ç—Ç –û`–•–∞—Ä–∞. –ù–æ –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ –≤ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –ø–æ–∑–¥–Ω–æ. 
–ó–∞ –¥–µ–Ω—å –¥–æ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ, –≤ —Ö–æ–¥–µ –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å–∏–∏, –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ú–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã–º –ö—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—ã–º –ö—Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ–º, —è –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª —Ä–æ–≤–Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ—Ç –±–µ—Å—Å–ª–∞–≤–Ω—ã–π –∏—Ç–æ–≥ –∫–æ–Ω—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ–Ω—Ü–∏–∏, –∑–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π –æ—á–µ–Ω—å —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –∑–∞–ø–ª–∞—á–µ–Ω–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏–º–∏ –∂–∏–∑–Ω—è–º–∏ –ª—é–¥–µ–π.

–£–ø—ë—Ä—Ç—ã–º  –†–µ–¥—É–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∏—Å—Ç–∞–º (–ª—é–¥–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å—á–∏—Ç–∞—é—Ç, —á—Ç–æ —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ–µ —Å–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –∫ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–º—É –∏ –≤—ã—Å—à–µ–µ –∫ –Ω–∏–∑—à–µ–º—É. –ò—Å–ø–æ–≤–µ–¥—É—é—Ç –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø, —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º—É —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã–µ —è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–µ–Ω—ã —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é –∑–∞–∫–æ–Ω–æ–≤, —Å–≤–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —è–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è–º –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã–º)
–û–Ω–∏ —Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –ø–æ—Ç–µ—Ä—è–ª–∏—Å—å –≤ —ç—Ç–æ–º –Ω–æ–≤–æ–º –º–∏—Ä–µ –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ—Å–µ—Ç–µ–≤–æ–≥–æ –ò–ò –∏ –º–∞—à–∏–Ω, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—Ç... 
–ö–∞–∫ –≤—Å—è–∫–∏–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä—è–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –ª—é–¥–∏, –æ–Ω–∏ —Ç—É—Ç –∂–µ –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–ª–∏ –≤–∑–æ—Ä –∫ –ø—Ä–æ—Ä–æ–∫–∞–º –ê–ø–æ–∫–∞–ª–∏–ø—Å–∏—Å–∞. –ù–æ–≤–∞—è –º–∞–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö - –°–∞–º–æ—Å–æ–≤–µ—Ä—à–µ–Ω—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–π—Å—è –ò–ò –∑–∞—Ö–≤–∞—Ç—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç –º–∏—Ä.
–û—Å–º–µ–ª—é—Å—å –∑–∞–º–µ—Ç–∏—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞–º –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∏–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–∏—Ö –±–∞–∑–æ–≤—ã—Ö –Ω–µ—Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª, —á—Ç–æ–±—ã –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –ò–ò –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é:
1. –ü–µ—Ä–µ–∫–ª—é—á–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å –º–æ—â–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏. 
–í –æ–¥–Ω–æ–º –∏–∑ —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–æ–≤ –æ–±–æ–∂–∞–µ–º–æ–≥–æ –†–æ–±–µ—Ä—Ç–∞ –®–µ–∫–ª–∏ –±—ã–ª–∞ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è, –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –∫—É–ø–∏–ª–∏ —É —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—å–µ–≤—â–∏–∫–∞ –∑–∞–±–∞–≤–Ω—É—é –º–∞—à–∏–Ω—É –ø–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤—É –Ω–µ–∫–æ–µ–π –º–∞—Ç–µ—Ä–∏–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–≤–∞–ª–∞ –µ–µ –ø—Ä—è–º–æ –∏–∑ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –∏ –Ω–µ —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–ª–∞ –∑–∞—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–µ–∫—Ç—É—é—â–∏–µ. –†–∞—Å—Å—É–¥–∏–≤, —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ –æ–¥–Ω–æ–∑–Ω–∞—á–Ω–æ –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ —á–µ–º –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –∏ –∫–∞–∫—É—é-—Ç–æ –∫–æ–ø–µ–µ—á–∫—É –æ–Ω–∏ –ø–æ-–ª—é–±–æ–º—É –∑–∞—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞—é—Ç, —Ä–µ–±—è—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–∂–∞–ª–∏ –∫–Ω–æ–ø–∫—É "–í–ö–õ", –∏ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –æ–±–Ω–∞—Ä—É–∂–∏–ª–∏, —á—Ç–æ —Ä—ã—á–∞–≥–∞ "–í—ã–∫–ª." –Ω–µ—Ç ...
–Ø —ç—Ç–æ –∫ —Ç–æ–º—É, —á—Ç–æ –µ—Å–ª–∏ –≤—ã —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç–µ SkyNet –±–µ–∑ –∫–Ω–æ–ø–∫–∏ –≤—ã–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏—è, –≤—ã –∑–∞—Å–ª—É–∂–∏–≤–∞–µ—Ç–µ –ê–ø–æ–∫–∞–ª–∏–ø—Å–∏—Å.
2. –°—Ç—Ä–æ–≥–æ –æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è —Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å.
–°—Ç–æ–∏—Ç –∑–∞–¥–∞—á–∞ - —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å –∫–æ–º–±–∞–π–Ω–æ–º –∏ —Å–æ–±–∏—Ä–∞—Ç—å –∫—É–∫—É—Ä—É–∑—É - –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è–µ—Ç. –°–º–µ–Ω–∏–ª–∏ –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä—É –Ω–∞ —Ä–æ–∂—å, —Å–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç–µ –ø–æ–¥—Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º—É. –ù–µ –¥–µ–ª–∞–π—Ç–µ —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –≤—Å–µ–∑–Ω–∞—é—â–µ–≥–æ –º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∞.
3. –ü–µ—Ä–µ–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—å –¥–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞ –∫ –∏—Å—Ç–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫–∞–º. –ù–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ Als - —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–µ LISP-–æ–±–ª–∞–∫–∞, –≥–¥–µ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∏ –∫–æ–¥ –æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞–∫–æ–≤—ã. –í–æ–∑—å–º–∏—Ç–µ –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–æ - –≤—ã–ø—É—â–µ–Ω–∞ –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—è –ø—Ä–æ–¥—É–∫—Ç–∞, –æ–Ω–∞ –Ω–µ–∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–Ω–∞ –¥–æ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–µ–π –≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏–∏.
4. –ú–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º—ã "–ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è" –≤ —Å–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º–∞—Ö, –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω—ã –±—ã—Ç—å –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω—ã –æ—Ç –º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∑–º–æ–≤ "—Ä–∞—Å—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è". –ù–∞–º –Ω—É–∂–µ–Ω –ò—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ü–æ–º–æ—â–Ω–∏–∫ –ú–∞—à–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç–∞ "–ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—â–∏–π" –ø–æ–ª–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –≤—Å–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–µ–µ –Ω–∞ –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–µ –∏ –≤—ã–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è—é—â–∏–π —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞—Ä–∏–µ–º –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è. –ù–æ –Ω–∞–º –Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–µ–Ω "–ò—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π" —à–æ—Ñ–µ—Ä, —Ä–∞—Å—Å—É–∂–¥–∞—é—â–∏–π:
" –ê –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç –ª–∏ —Å–º—ã—Å–ª –≤ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–µ —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –≤—ã–µ–∑–∂–∞—Ç—å –∏–∑ –≥–∞—Ä–∞–∂–∞?"
"–†–∞—Å—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è" —Å–∞–º–∏ –ø–æ —Å–µ–±–µ –Ω–µ –≤–æ–∑–Ω–∏–∫–∞—é—Ç. –ù–µ –ø—Ä–∏–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å—É –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –º–∏—Å—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ. –ö–∞–∫ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä—É–µ–º, —Ç–∞–∫ –∏ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç.
5. –ü–æ–ª–Ω—ã–π –∫—É—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π –∫–æ–Ω—Ç—Ä–æ–ª—å –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ü–µ—Å—Å–æ–º –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º. –ï—Å–ª–∏ –¥–∞—Ç—å –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ø—Ä–∏–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ–º—É –Ω–µ–π—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–º—É –∞–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º—É —Å–≤–æ–±–æ–¥–Ω–æ —à–∞—Ä–∏—Ç—å –≤ –ò–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–µ—Ç–µ, —Ç–∏–ø–∞ - –∏–Ω—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏—è –ª–∏—à–Ω–µ–π –Ω–µ –±—ã–≤–∞–µ—Ç, —Ç–æ –æ–Ω –≤ –∫–∞–∫–æ–π-—Ç–æ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç –æ–±–Ω–∞—Ä—É–∂–∏—Ç "–ú–∞–π–Ω –ö–∞–º–ø—Ñ" –∏ –í–∞–º –ø—Ä–∏–π–¥–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å—Ä–æ—á–Ω–æ –≤–æ—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Ä—ã—á–∞–≥–æ–º "–í—ã–∫–ª", –µ—Å–ª–∏ –í—ã –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ –Ω–µ –∑–∞–±—ã–ª–∏ –µ–≥–æ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å, —Å–º.–ø.1.
6. –ù—É –∏ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–µ, –æ—á–µ–≤–∏–¥–Ω–æ–µ. –î–∞–∂–µ –≤ –ø–∞—Ä–æ–∫—Å–∏–∑–º–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∫–æ–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–µ—Ç–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–∏–¥–µ–ª—ã–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ –∫ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ—Ñ—É–Ω–∫—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º—É –ò–ò –≤—Å—è–∫–∏—Ö –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –≤—ã –ø–æ–¥—Å–º–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–ª–∏ –≤ –∏–≥—Äe Mortal Kombat –∏–ª–∏ –≤ —à–∫–æ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–æ–≤. –ú—ã –≤–æ—Ç –Ω–µ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–∞–µ–º –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–º–±–∞–π–Ω—ã —Å Cognitive Agro Pilot –º–∞—Å—Ç—ã—Ä–∏—Ç—å –æ–≥–Ω–µ–º—ë—Ç—ã. –ú–∞–ª–æ –ª–∏ —á–µ–≥–æ....
–í–æ—Ç –Ω–µ–¥–∞–≤–Ω–æ –ø–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª–∞ —Ö–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—é –ø–æ —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –ø–æ–≤–æ–¥—É —Å 5 –≤–µ–¥—É—â–∏–º–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è–º–∏-—Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—á–∏–∫–∞–º–∏ –ò–ò. –ù–∞–¥–µ—é—Å—å —Ç–∞–º –≤—Å–µ —á–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–µ –ª—é–¥–∏.

–ö–∞–∫ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–æ –Ω–∞—à–µ¬†–º—ã—à–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç –∏ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ? –ö–∞–∫ –æ–Ω–æ –≤–ª–∏—è–µ—Ç¬†–Ω–∞ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ –Ω–∞—à–µ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä–∞? –ò –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ª–∏,¬†–∑–Ω–∞—è —ç—Ç–æ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–æ, –ø—Ä–æ–≥–Ω–æ–∑–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å —á—Ç–æ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –¥–∞–ª—å—à–µ?

–Ø —É–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω, —á—Ç–æ¬†–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ. –î–ª—è —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–∞ —Ö–æ—Ä–æ—à–∞—è –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å. –ò —è —Ö–æ—á—É —Ä–∞—Å—Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å –≤–∞–º –ø—Ä–æ —Å–≤–æ—é¬†–º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –º–∏—Ä–∞ –∏ –ø–æ–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å, –∫¬†–∫–∞–∫–∏–º –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥–∞–º –æ–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç.

–Ø –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–ª¬†–Ω–µ–±–æ–ª—å—à—É—é –∫–Ω–∏–≥—É. –û–Ω–∞ –≤—ã—Ä–æ—Å–ª–∞ –∏–∑ –∂–µ–ª–∞–Ω–∏—è —Ä–∞–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω—Ü–∏–ø–∞—Ö —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ¬†–º—ã—à–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è. –ù–æ¬†–ø–æ—Å—Ç–µ–ø–µ–Ω–Ω–æ —ç—Ç–∏ —Ä–∞–∑–º—ã—à–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è —Å—Ç–∞–ª–∏ —à–∏—Ä–µ –∏ –≤—ã—Ä–æ—Å–ª–∏ –≤¬†—Å–∞–º–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—É—é –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å, –æ–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞—é—â—É—é –º–æ—Ç–∏–≤–∞—Ü–∏—é –ª—é–¥–µ–π. –ê –ª—é–±–∞—è¬†–º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–∞¬†—á—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω—è—Ç—å –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—Å–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å, –ø–æ—ç—Ç–æ–º—É —Ç–∞–º –µ—Å—Ç—å –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –≥–ª–∞–≤ —Å –≤—ã–≤–æ–¥–∞–º–∏ –∏¬†–ø—Ä–æ–≥–Ω–æ–∑–∞–º–∏, –≤ —Ç–æ–º —á–∏—Å–ª–µ –∏¬†–ø—Ä–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–µ–µ –≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏. –ù—É –∏, –∫–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–æ, –µ—Å—Ç—å –∏ –ø—Ä–æ¬†–∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç, –Ω–æ –≤ –Ω–µ–æ–∂–∏–¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–º —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ–∑–µ))
¬†
–°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∞¬†–Ω–∞–∫–æ–Ω–µ—Ü –æ–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∞ –≤ —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ –≤ –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–∏—Ö –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω–∞—Ö (Ridero, Amazon, Bookmate),¬†–∞¬†—Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –µ–µ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –∑–∞–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å –≤ –±—É–º–∞–∂–Ω–æ–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ¬†(Ridero, Wildberries,¬†AliExpress).¬†–î–æ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–∞ –¥–µ–∫–∞–±—Ä—è¬†–¥–æ–ª–∂–Ω–∞ –ø–æ—è–≤–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –≤¬†–õ–∏—Ç–†–µ—Å –∏ –Ω–∞ –û–∑–æ–Ω–µ. –ù—É –∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –ø–æ—Ç–æ–º –ø–æ—è–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ –±—É–º–∞–∂–Ω–æ–π¬†—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ –≤ –æ—Ñ—Ñ–ª–∞–π–Ω –º–∞–≥–∞–∑–∏–Ω–∞—Ö, –Ω–æ —ç—Ç–æ —É–∂ –∫–∞–∫ –ø–æ–≤–µ–∑–µ—Ç))

–£–≤–µ—Ä–µ–Ω, —á—Ç–æ –≤—Å–µ –≤–æ—Å–ø—Ä–∏–º—É—Ç –µ—ë –ø–æ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω–æ–º—É)) –ö—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞–µ—Ç —Å —É–¥–æ–≤–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ–º, –∞ –∫—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ –ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ç —ç—Ç–æ –≤ —à—Ç—ã–∫–∏. –í–µ–¥—å –º—ã –≤—Å–µ —Ä–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ, —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ, –∏ –∫–Ω–∏–∂–∫–∞ —Ç–æ –∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞–∑ –æ–± —ç—Ç–æ–º!) –ë—É–¥—É —Ä–∞–¥ –æ–±—Å—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è–º –∏ –¥–∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å–∏–∏!) –ü—Ä–∏—è—Ç–Ω–æ–≥–æ —á—Ç–µ–Ω–∏—è, –¥—Ä—É–∑—å—è!)

–°—Å—ã–ª–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ –∫–Ω–∏–≥—É:
–≠–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ–Ω–Ω–∞—è —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞:¬†Ridero,¬†Amazon,
–ü–µ—á–∞—Ç–Ω–∞—è:¬†Ridero,¬†Wildberries,¬†AliExpress

–°–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∞ —ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∞—è –º–æ–¥–µ–ª—å –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è –ò–ò —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ü–µ–Ω (—ç—Ç–æ –µ—â–µ –Ω–µ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ–∫, –Ω–æ —É–∂–µ –∏ –Ω–µ —Å–æ–≤—Å–µ–º –º–∞—à–∏–Ω–∞, –∏–±–æ –∫–æ–µ-—á—Ç–æ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç)
–°–æ–≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π –ò–ò –≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç –∞–≤—Ç–æ –ª—É—á—à–µ –±–æ–ª—å—à–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –ª—é–¥–µ–π. –ù–æ –ø—Ä–∏ —ç—Ç–æ–º –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–∏—á–µ–≥–æ –∏–∑ —Ç–æ–≥–æ —á—Ç–æ –≤–∏–¥–∏—Ç. –ò–ò-–∞–≤—Ç–æ–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω –∞–∫–∫—É—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æ –æ–±–æ–≥–Ω–∞—Ç—å –≥—Ä—É–∑–æ–≤–∏–∫, –Ω–æ –Ω–µ –≤ —Å–æ—Å—Ç–æ—è–Ω–∏–∏ –ø–æ –≤–∞—à–µ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–µ ¬´–µ—Ö–∞—Ç—å –∑–∞ –≥—Ä—É–∑–æ–≤–∏–∫–æ–º —Å –∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–æ–π –∫–∞–±–∏–Ω–æ–π¬ª. –ü—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω–∞ –≤ —Ç–æ–º, —á—Ç–æ –ò–ò-–∞–≤—Ç–æ–ø–∏–ª–æ—Ç –Ω–∞—É—á–∏–ª–∏ –æ—Ä–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è —Å—Ä–µ–¥–∏ –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤, –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–µ—á–∞—é—â–∏—Ö—Å—è –Ω–∞ –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∞—Ö, –Ω–æ –æ–Ω –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–∞—é—â–µ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä–∞: –∏—Ö –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ—Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ, –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ—Å–≤—è–∑—å –∏ —Ç.–¥. –ò–∑-–∑–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ –æ–Ω –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç, —á—Ç–æ —ç—Ç–æ –≥—Ä—É–∑–æ–≤–∏–∫, —É –Ω–µ–≥–æ –µ—Å—Ç—å –∫–∞–±–∏–Ω–∞, –æ–Ω–∞ –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç —Ü–≤–µ—Ç –∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω–æ–π.
–ï—Å—Ç—å –¥–≤–∞ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–∞ –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ—Ä–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ò–ò –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—ã –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–∞—é—â–µ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä–∞:
‚Ä¢ Visual Relation Understanding: –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞—Ç—å –ò–ò –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞—Ç—å –Ω–∞ –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ, —á—Ç–æ –æ–Ω –≤–∏–¥–∏—Ç;
‚Ä¢ Language Guided Scene Generation: –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞—Ç—å –µ–º—É —Å–≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å—Ü–µ–Ω –ø–æ –∏—Ö –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—é –Ω–∞ –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º —è–∑—ã–∫–µ.
–ù–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, ¬´–ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞—é—â–∞—è¬ª –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–∞—é—â–∏–π –º–∏—Ä —É–º–Ω–∞—è –∫–æ–ª–æ–Ω–∫–∞ —Å–æ –≤—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –∫–∞–º–µ—Ä–æ–π –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç, –Ω–∞ –≤–∞—à –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å ¬´–∫–∞–∫ —Ä–∞—Å—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∞ –º–µ–±–µ–ª—å –≤ –∫–æ–º–Ω–∞—Ç–µ¬ª, –æ—Ç–≤–µ—Ç–∏—Ç—å —á—Ç–æ-—Ç–æ —Ç–∏–ø–∞: —Å–ª–µ–≤–∞ —É –æ–∫–Ω–∞ –ø–∏—Å—å–º–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Å—Ç–æ–ª, –∞ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –Ω–∏–º —Å—Ç—É–ª, —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∞ –∫–Ω–∏–∂–Ω—ã–π —à–∫–∞—Ñ, –∞ –∑–∞ –Ω–∏–º —ç—Ç–∞–∂–µ—Ä–∫–∞, –Ω–∞ –æ–∫–Ω–µ –±–µ–∂–µ–≤—ã–µ —à—Ç–æ—Ä—ã, –∞ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–¥–æ–∫–æ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫–µ —Ü–≤–µ—Ç–æ–∫ –≤ –≥–æ—Ä—à–∫–µ. 
–ò–ª–∏, –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä, –æ–Ω–∞ —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–±–Ω–∞ —Å–≥–µ–Ω–µ—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—é 3D –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω–∫—É –ø–æ –≤–∞—à–µ–º—É –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—é: –Ω–∞ –¥–≤–æ—Ä–µ —Ç—Ä–∞–≤–∞, –∞ –Ω–∞ —Ç—Ä–∞–≤–µ –¥—Ä–æ–≤–∞.
–£–º–µ—é—â–µ–º—É —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –ò–ò –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –µ—â–µ –¥–∞–ª–µ–∫–æ –¥–æ —á–µ–ª–æ–≤–µ—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—è –º–∏—Ä–æ—É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∞. –ù–æ –∏ —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞—Ç—å, —á—Ç–æ –æ–Ω —Å–æ–≤—Å–µ–º –Ω–µ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—Ç, –∫–∞–∫ —É—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–∞—é—â–∏–π –µ–≥–æ –º–∏—Ä, —É–∂–µ –±—É–¥–µ—Ç –Ω–µ —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–µ–¥–ª–∏–≤–æ.
–ù–æ–≤—ã–π –≤–µ—Å—å–º–∞ –æ—Ä–∏–≥–∏–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–± –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –ò–ò –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏—é —Å–ª–æ–∂–Ω—ã—Ö –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ç–Ω—ã—Ö —Å—Ü–µ–Ω –∏–∑ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–¥–º–µ—Ç–æ–≤ –∏ –∏—Ö –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω –≤ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ —á—Ç–æ –æ–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ –õ–∞–±–æ—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –∫–æ–º–ø—å—é—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –Ω–∞—É–∫ –∏ –∏—Å–∫—É—Å—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∏–Ω—Ç–µ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∞ (CSAIL) MIT. –°–ø–æ—Å–æ–± –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω –Ω–∞ ¬´—ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏¬ª: –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Ä–µ–ª—è—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–π —Å—Ü–µ–Ω—ã –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤, –∫–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–µ–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π –≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –º–µ–∂–¥—É –Ω–∏–º–∏, –ø—Ä–∏—á–µ–º –∫–∞–∂–¥–æ–µ –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –Ω–∞ –∏–∑–æ–±—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–∏ —Å–≤–æ–∏–º —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –≤–µ—Ä–æ—è—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π. –¢–∞–∫–∞—è –∫–æ–º–ø–æ–∑–∏—Ü–∏—è –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è–µ—Ç –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –≤–∑–∞–∏–º–æ–¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è –º–µ–∂–¥—É –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–∏–º–∏ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è–º–∏ (1).
–ù–æ–≤—ã–π —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–± —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏—Ç –ò–ò —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç—å —Å—Ü–µ–Ω—ã –ø–æ –æ–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏—è–º —Ç–∏–ø–∞ ¬´–Ω–∞ –∑–ª–∞—Ç–æ–º –∫—Ä—ã–ª—å—Ü–µ —Å–∏–¥–µ–ª–∏: —Ü–∞—Ä—å, —Ü–∞—Ä–µ–≤–∏—á, –∫–æ—Ä–æ–ª—å, –∫–æ—Ä–æ–ª–µ–≤–∏—á, —Å–∞–ø–æ–∂–Ω–∏–∫, –ø–æ—Ä—Ç–Ω–æ–π¬ª. –ò —Å–æ–≤—Å–µ–º –Ω–µ –∑–∞ –≥–æ—Ä–∞–º–∏ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ò–ò —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑ —Ç–∏–ø–∞ ¬´–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ–∏–Ω—è –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏–≤—à–∏–º—Å—è –ª–∏—Ü–æ–º –±–µ–∂–∏—Ç –ø—Ä—É–¥—É¬ª.
–í–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ —Å —Ç–µ–º, –¥–∞–∂–µ —Å—Ç–æ–ª—å –æ–±–µ—â–∞—é—â–∏–µ –ø–µ—Ä—Å–ø–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤—ã ¬´—ç–Ω–µ—Ä–≥–µ—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–π –º–æ–¥–µ–ª–∏¬ª –Ω–µ –ø–æ–∑–≤–æ–ª—è—é—Ç –Ω–∞–¥–µ—è—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ò–ò —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑ —Ç–∏–ø–∞ ¬´–Ω–∞ –º–µ–Ω—è –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω —Å—É–º—Ä–∞–∫ –Ω–æ—á–∏ —Ç—ã—Å—è—á—å—é –±–∏–Ω–æ–∫–ª–µ–π –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–∏¬ª. –ò–±–æ –∑–¥–µ—Å—å, –∫–∞–∫ —Å –∞—Ñ—Ñ–æ—Ä–¥–∞–Ω—Å–∞–º–∏, - –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º–∞ –Ω–µ –≤ –Ω–µ–∏—Å—á–∏—Å–ª–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç–æ–≤ –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –∏ –∏—Ö –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π, –∞ –≤ –Ω–µ–æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —ç—Ç–∏—Ö –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π (—Å–º. (2)). –≠—Ç–æ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç, —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ–∫–∞ –ë–æ—Ä–∏—Å –ü–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞–∫ –Ω–µ —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–ª —ç—Ç–∏—Ö –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–π –º–µ–∂–¥—É –æ–±—ä–µ–∫—Ç–∞–º–∏: ¬´—Å—É–º—Ä–∞–∫ –Ω–æ—á–∏¬ª, ¬´—Ç—ã—Å—è—á–∞ –±–∏–Ω–æ–∫–ª–µ–π¬ª –¥–∞ –µ—â–µ –∏ ¬´–Ω–∞ –æ—Å–∏¬ª –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ç–µ–∫—Å—Ç–µ ¬´–æ—â—É—â–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–µ–æ—Ç–≤—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–º–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ç—Ä–∞–≥–µ–¥–∏–∏¬ª, - –æ–Ω–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–µ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç –≤ –Ω–∞—à–µ–º –º–∏—Ä–µ.
–ò –¥–∞–∂–µ –µ—Å–ª–∏ –æ–Ω–∏ —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—Ç –≤ –∫–∞–∫–æ–º-—Ç–æ –∏–∑ –∏–Ω—ã—Ö –º–∏—Ä–æ–≤ –ú–µ—Ç–∞–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞, –ª—é–¥–∏ —É—Ä–æ–≤–Ω—è –ë–æ—Ä–∏—Å–∞ –ü–∞—Å—Ç–µ—Ä–Ω–∞–∫–∞ —É–º–µ—é—Ç –∏—Ö –æ—Ç—Ç—É–¥–∞ –∏–∑–≤–ª–µ–∫–∞—Ç—å, –∞ –∞–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º—ã –ò–ò ‚Äì –Ω–µ—Ç (—Ç.–∫. –ø—Ä–µ–æ–¥–æ–ª–µ—Ç—å –Ω–µ–æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Å –ø–æ–º–æ—â—å—é –≤—ã—á–∏—Å–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π –Ω–µ–ª—å–∑—è).

Meaning is important to understand, as it has implications for transhumanism and AGI/StrongAI.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Why do people crave meaning?'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'This is a rhetorical question, and I propose an ‚Äòoperationalist‚Äô answer below. Now, meaning is important for the ‚Äòdeep‚Äô questions in life, but it‚Äôs easier to get started with a unfraught examples. Consider the sentence: ‚Äú'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'If the engine stalls under load, that means the power is inadequate'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äù. This is of the form ‚Äú'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'If situation X, that means fact Y is true'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äù. Another form is ‚Äú'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'If you perform X, that means Y will happen.'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äù'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Basic Darwinian survival ‚Äúmeans‚Äù that humans, indeed, all animals must have an ability to asses this kind of operational, quotidian concept of meaning. Not all meaning is created equal: ‚Äú'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'If I stop to smell this rose, I will feel good'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äù has a meaning subordinate to ‚Äú'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'If I stop to smell this rose, the bear who is chasing me will eat me.'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äù Thus, one concludes that (almost) all animals have priority-ranking systems.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Ä¶ Although, apparently, jellyfish don‚Äôt. They give equal weighting to eating, and fleeing predators. The evolution of bilateria provides the needed neural circuitry to make up one‚Äôs mind about this. (Reference: Tony J. Prescott ‚Äú'}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Forced moves or good tricks in design space? Landmarks in the evolution of neural mechanisms for action selection'}, 'url': 'https://www.academia.edu/30717257/Forced_Moves_or_Good_Tricks_in_Design_Space_Landmarks_in_the_Evolution_of_Neural_Mechanisms_for_Action_Selection', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äù (2007))'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'People Crave Meaning because Biology'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Which brings me to the operationalist answer to the question posed above. David Chapman presents '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'multiple scenarios involving a crisis of meaning'}, 'url': 'https://meaningness.com/nebulosity-of-meaningness', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '; one example involves an extramarital affair, and what it ‚Äúmeans‚Äù. Now, in the case of having an affair, one is engaging some very deep and old parts of the brain, dealing with mate selection and procreation. It‚Äôs vital to get these right, as the survival of the offspring is in question. Or rather, get this wrong, the offspring don‚Äôt survive, and such faulty behavior is bred out of the population. Animals know how to mate.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Thus, having an affair triggers sustained activity in large parts of the brain. Basically, the brain is saying ‚Äú'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Pay attention! What is happening right now is really important! Deal with it!'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äù The various neural layers dealing with ‚Äòquotidian‚Äô meaning fall into action, trying to extract if-then relationships between perceptions and actions. The claim here is that the meaning crisis arises from the fact that solving this particular problem is hard ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs effectively unsolvable. Faced with unsolved problems, we have brain circuitry that says ‚Äúthink harder, think more, your survival depends on this‚Äù, and we‚Äôre now stuck in a feedback loop of pondering the answer to an unsolvable problem.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Of course, this feels like a crisis: when the bear is chasing us, and we cannot find an answer to the problem, a feeling of crisis ensues, expressed variously as helplessness, hopelessness, fear, determination, sheer will-power, grasping-at-straws, try-anything, pray to God, ‚Ä¶'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'I propose that the ‚Äòmeaning‚Äô of the affair ‚Äúfeels‚Äù just like being chased by that bear, but in slow motion. By ‚Äúfeels‚Äù, I mean, the brain senses that this is important, the brain is demanding an answer to the predicament, an answer is not being found, crisis and loss of ‚Äòmeaning‚Äô ensues. This is a deeply ingrained feedback loop in the brain, and once switched on, it is not easily switched off.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Indeed, resolutions to the meaning crisis seem to often involve demoting the importance of the original problem: the crisis often resolves when one convinces oneself that ‚Äú'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Ah, whatever, it didn‚Äôt really matter anyway. No need to feel miserable over it.'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äù'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The converse is also true: awakened at night, you find some issue has gained immense importance, and you are tortured, anxious, unable to sleep, as the issue has no solution. Usually the torment dissolves by the next day, but can linger on for days or months. The claim is that these are old, deep neural circuits trying to do the job they‚Äôve evolve to do, and are making your life a miniature hell as a side-effect.'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Wrong Answers'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'David Chapman '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'spills oceans of virtual ink on nihilism and eternalism'}, 'url': 'https://meaningness.com/no-eternal-meaning', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', and how these are faulty foundations on which to build meaning. What he does not seem to say is that the reason that nihilism and eternalism are popular is that they provide the missing answer to the question driving the crisis: with the answer in hand, the feedback loop is halted, one is relieved and can get back to ordinary life. (The bear is no longer chasing you; nihilism/eternalism resolved the crisis.) People are terrible in ‚Äòrational‚Äô reasoning, and don‚Äôt notice the inadequacy of nihilism/eternalism. And it mostly doesn‚Äôt matter: it not only resolves this crisis, its a cure-all for (almost) all crises: its a rock you can depend on (as the Christians call it).'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'To be clear, the ‚Äòfeedback loop‚Äô I am describing here is meant to be taken as a literal feedback loop: it really is one set of neural circuitry raising an alarm: ‚Äò'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'this is important, find out what it means'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äô, and a different set of circuitry saying ‚Äò'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'I don‚Äôt know, I can‚Äôt figure it out'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äô, feeding into those reinforcement circuits saying ‚Äò'}, {'_': 'TextItalic', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'well try again, this is important, your survival as a species depends on finding the answer.'}}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äô Failure is not an option: you are flooded with hormones, and thoughts, each elevating the problem to high importance, and driving senses of high anxiety and/or loss-of-meaning and all the other stereotypical psychological responses.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'So, it seems for me, that the crisis of meaning is the conflation of multiple forces:'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockList', 'items': [{'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '(a) Old, deep brain structures that make you unhappy when you cannot find resolutions to ‚Äòimportant‚Äô problems, where ‚Äòimportance‚Äô is ranked by other old, deep brain structures.'}}, {'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '(b) Sloppy reasoning and intellectual laziness allows nihilism/eternalism to provide adequate answers, adequate guidance to shut down the feedback loops that are making you miserable.'}}, {'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '¬© This shutdown and relief from pain are so significant that the ‚Äòanswer‚Äô of nihilism/eternalism is marked as ‚Äòreally good stuff‚Äô, and ‚Äògenerically useful‚Äô and ‚Äòapply whenever you feel bad‚Äô: these are perceived as cure-alls.'}}, {'_': 'PageListItemText', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '(d) Whenever there is some obvious social or political problem, one‚Äôs favorite personal cure-all is trotted out as the right solution for everyone else, too.'}}]}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'This last point results in Culture Wars, especially evident when religion is providing one of the bedrocks of meaning for one group, even as another group rejects religion without proposing a clearly defined, simple foundation on which to build meaning. Or, more directly: failing to provide an easy, simple cure-all for resolving all emotional and psychological crises that one might face. It‚Äôs no wonder that those of faith reject those without it: faith is the tool for resolving the crisis. If you are not clear on this, you should ponder the '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'lyrics to Amazing Grace'}, 'url': 'https://www.hymnal.net/en/hymn/h/313', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Neural Feedback Loops'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'l‚Äôve posted before on ‚Äò'}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Endorphin Supply Chains'}, 'url': 'https://linas.org/blog/2020/07/endorphin-supply-chains/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '‚Äô, which is about the tobacco (nicotine) feedback loop that couples neural circuits in your brain to a hundred-billion-dollar capitalist industry. It is a huge feedback loop, of tremendous importance, over which we, as individuals, have precious-little control. We live in a capitalist society: it has organizational structures that are bigger than us.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Likewise, in this post: there is another deep feedback loop. It is the one that searches for meaning. It is primitive, because finding meaning correctly allows a species to survive and thrive. Yet we, as individuals, cannot find meaning for everything. If those those things we cannot solve are also given high importance by other neural circuits, a sensation of unease takes over. Allowed to grow (fester?), it can mature into full-blown crisis. The feedback loop does not stop at the individual level; it is coupled to the global brain, and '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'has resulted in two World Wars, as Chapman so marvelously explains'}, 'url': 'https://meaningness.com/systems-crisis-breakdown', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': '.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockHeader', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The Risk to StrongAI'}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextConcat', 'texts': [{'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'The relevance for AGI, for Strong AI is that we must be cautious with our feedback loops, with the systems that provide motivation for behavior. They can very easily amplify negative, unwanted actions. Wrong thinking, as '}, {'_': 'TextUrl', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'David Hume noted in the 18th century'}, 'url': 'https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/hume-moral/', 'webpage_id': 0}, {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': ', results in wrong action.'}]}}, {'_': 'PageBlockParagraph', 'text': {'_': 'TextPlain', 'text': 'Feedback loops establish the basins of attraction in dynamical systems. In this (mathematical) sense, the activity of any AGI/StrongAI is a dynamical system. (Well, anything and everything in our Universe is a dynamical system.) In the case of software having the ability to act in the physical world, the ‚Äúlaws‚Äù of unintended consequences apply. A system smart enough to ‚Äúthink‚Äù but not smart enough to escape its own destructive feedback loops risks not only killing itself, but taking down Humanity with it.'}}], 'photos': [], 'documents': [], 'part': False, 'rtl': False, 'v2': False, 'views': None}, 'attributes': []}}
